title: Image processing method and apparatus
abstract: When a color reproduction model of a device is generated, colorimetry of a 9×9×9 grid, for example, is performed utilizing equidistant signal values in the color space of the device. Generally, if the number of grid points is increased, the precision with which the color reproduction model is estimated rises but the time needed for measurement is prolonged because the number of colorimetric measurements is also increased. Accordingly, in a printer system comprising a pre-color-processing table for performing color matching and a post-color-processing table for performing color separation, color patches set non-equidistantly in RGB device color space are printed in accordance with changeover of printer CMYKcm signals in the post-color-processing table and the color reproduction model of the printer is generated using data obtained by measuring the colors of the color patches.

title: System and methods enabling a mix of human and automated initiatives in the control of communication policies
abstract: A system and method for identifying communication channels and appropriate timing of communications that facilitate enhancing or maximizing the utility of a communication between communicating parties, based on the participants' preferences and capabilities is provided. The system and method implement policies for facilitating optimal communications between communicating parties based on deterministic and/or uncertain preferences, capabilities and context, both present and predicted, where a decision to employ an initially selected channel and timing of communication may be overridden by contactor or contactee based on user-configurable triggers. The system and method further provide for mixed/multi-initiative overriding of the identified optimal communication channel and indicated best time for a communication. The methods can be implemented on a widescale communication system or within a single portable device. In one approach, the system attempts to optimize the inferred or directly accessed preferences of a contactee given the accessed or inferred preferences, capabilities and goals of the contactor while keeping the rationale and context of the contactee private. Such optimization can be achieved using preferences and policies concerning handling the attempted contact based on a deterministic specification or through inferring context, content and task under uncertainty by employing probabilistic or decision-theoretic inferences to attempt to maximize the expected utility of the communication to the contactee.

title: System and methods for training a trainee to classify fundamental properties of media entities
abstract: A system and methods are provided for training a trainee to analyze media, such as music, in order to recognize and assess the fundamental properties of any piece of media, such as a song or a segment of a song. The process includes an initial tutorial and a double grooving process. The tutorial phase exposes the trainee to a canonical set of classifications and then exposes the trainee to certain definitive song examples for each classification level of fundamental properties. The double grooving phase leverages the skills of the experts that defined the canonical set of classification terms to ensure that new listeners, even though exposed to the tutorial, appropriately recognize all fundamental musical properties. Thus, for specific song examples, a new listener matches results with the system experts within a degree of tolerance. When a high enough degree of cross-listening consensus is reached, the new listener becomes a groover and can classify new songs or segments of songs.

title: Method and apparatus for card handling device calibration
abstract: A device for automatically calibrating for card size and thickness during card handling is disclosed. The device includes a card receiving area, a card stacking area and a card moving system for moving cards from the card receiving area to the card stacking area. An elevator located in the card stacking area has a movable platform for moving a stack of cards. At least one sensor senses at least one of position of the platform, height of the platform, position of a card in the elevator, height of a card or cards in the elevator, pressure applied to a card in the elevator, presence of the platform at a predetermined height, presence of the platform at a predetermined position, presence of card(s) on the platform, and absence of card(s) on the platform. A method for calibrating a card handling device during shuffling is also disclosed.

title: Camouflage U.S. Marine corps utility uniform: pattern, fabric, and design
abstract: A disruptive camouflage pattern system to be used for both military and civilian applications. The system includes specialized techniques for printing the camouflage pattern system unto fabric. The system provides camouflage in both the human visible light and the near infrared range. The system depends on macro pattern resulting from a repeat of a micro pattern. The coloring used includes at least four colorings from dyes that in combination produce a percent reflectance value comparable to that of the negative space of the camouflaged subject's surroundings. The system functions by a macro pattern being disruptive of the subject's shape and a micro pattern having sharp edge units of a size capable of blending the subject into its background. The relative lightness values and percentages of total pattern, wet or dry, are sufficient to produce a percent reflectance of acceptable colors, in terms of lightness values unlike current four-color camouflage.

title: Information processing method and apparatus
abstract: An input coordinate sequence is acquired by sampling a handwritten input pattern at predetermined intervals, and a pattern expressed by this input coordinate sequence is approximated by coupling a plurality of line segments to attain line segment conversion. Adjacent angle data φ[i] is generated based on the directions of the respective line segments. At this time, the segment line length along line segments of all the line segments is divided by a predetermined value at equal intervals, and the angles obtained from the directions of the line segments at respective division positions are defined as φ[i]. This φ[i] is compared with a standard pattern (adjacent angle distribution data) prepared in advance to obtain a matching level. In this way, more accurate pattern matching for a handwritten input, which is approximately invariant to affine transformation and can reduce the influence of discretization errors can be implemented.

title: Method and system for finding similar records in mixed free-text and structured data
abstract: A technique for data mining where the available data contains both structured as well as unstructured (free-text) data. The present invention combines together the information available from different types of data to provide a single similarity score indicating the degree of similarity between records. Thus, a data evaluation application selects two records from a database and compares corresponding fields from the two records. The application determines whether to apply a nominal matching process, an ordinal matching process, or a vector-space matching process depending on the type of data in each pair of corresponding fields. The application sums the matching scores for all the fields in the records to compute the similarity score.

title: Multispectral-hyperspectral sensing system
abstract: The Multispectral-Hyperspectral Sensing System (MHSS) comprises a control center, a surveillance platform and at least one weapon battery with known sensing and destroying capabilities. The control center has access to pre-existing information relating to the target scene and potential targets, although not necessarily current, as well as the capabilities and limitations of the available weapons. This pre-existing information is communicated to the surveillance platform to be used in collecting hyperspectral/multispectral image data of the target scenery and to derive from the collected image data the relevant current target data subset. The derived data subset is then down-linked to the control center, which performs further processing to make it useful to the selected weapon. The weapon receives the target signature update from the control center and, in response, performs a significantly more precise strike at the selected target than based just on the a priori knowledge base.

title: Method and system for automatic water distribution model calibration
abstract: A water distribution model calibration technique is provided that allows a user to design a calibration model by selecting several input parameters desired to be used for the calibration of a model that allows an engineer to collect a complete set of data to represent the overall system conditions at any given time of day. For example, several parameters may be chosen including link status, the pipe roughness coefficient, junction demand, and pipe and valve operational status. Trial solutions of the model calibration are generated by a genetic algorithm program. A hydraulic network solver program then simulates each trial solution. A calibration module runs a calibration evaluation program to evaluate how closely the model simulation is to the observed data.

title: Matrix-addressable array of integrated transistor/memory structures
abstract: In an array of integrated transistor/memory structures the array includes one or more layers of semiconducting material, two or more electrode layers, and memory material contacting electrodes in the latter. At least one layer of a semiconducting material and two electrode layers form transistor structures such that the electrodes of the first electrode layer forms source/drain electrode pairs and those of a second electrode layer form the gate electrodes thereof. The source and drain electrodes of a single transistor/memory structure are separated by a narrow recess extending down to the semiconducting layer wherein the transistor channel is provided beneath the recess and with extremely small width, while the source and drain regions are provided beneath the respective source and drain electrodes on either side of the transistor channel. Memory material is provided in the recess and contacts the electrodes of the transistor.

title: High density optical disk having capacity of 25GB
abstract: A high density disc having a data area which is set such that compatibility is secured in the same drive while maintaining a superior recording/reproducing feature, is disclosed.The high density disc has a center hole, a clamping area, a data area where user data is recorded, a lead in area located at the inner side of the data area, and a lead out area located at the outer side of the data area. In the high density disc in which the diameter of the center hole is 10 mm or more, the inner diameter of the clamping area is characteristically within a range of 20–26 mm. Also, the inner diameter of the data area is characteristically within a range of 35–40 mm.Therefore, while a conventional disc drive is still used, the size of the high density disc decreases and a recording capacity can be increased.

title: DEVICE AND METHOD FOR THE OPTICAL RECORDING OF THE MOVEMENT OF OBJECTS
abstract: Optical sensing systems and methods for detecting target characteristics are disclosed. An optical sensing system can detect target motion within a known environment. A laser source, such as a vertical cavity surface emitting laser, has at least two laser signal emission apertures. At least one detector is operationally responsive to laser signals. A motion analysis module cooperates with a microprocessor to determine motion characteristics of an objected detected within said environment. A laser source emits at least two laser signals into an environment occupied by a target, said at least one detector detects changes in said at least two laser signals after said signals pass through said environment and interfere with a detected object, and said microprocessor determines target characteristics based on said signals received by said detector and input from said motion analysis module, at least one detector, which is operationally responsive to the laser source. The system can also include a microprocessor that is operationally coupled to the detector(s) for processing signal data, a memory accessible by the microprocessor for storing target characteristics (e.g., unique signals), and a software module accessible by the microprocessor for enabling system training and detection operations.

Already in 1961, Liberson and his staff beat the application electrical stimulation (ES) for the fibularis / peroneus communis to correct this condition while using a footswitch synchronized the application of the ES with the swing phase of the gear, using a device hereinafter referred to as a peroneal stimulator (PS) or as a fall foot stimulator (DFS) [Liberson W.T., Holmquest, H.J., Scott, D., and Dow, M., (1961) Functional Electrotherapy in Stimulation of the peroneal nerve synchronized with the swing phase of gait in hemiparetic patients. Arch Phys Med Rehabil 42, 202-205].  (i) Hardwired Single Channel Surface DFS: As indicated above, the first reported use of electrical stimulation for the correction of the hemiphlegic fall foot was by Liberson in 1961, who suggested that a dorsiflexion synchronized with the phase of the gait be obtained in a hemiphlegic foot. Liberson's solution in1shown included a power and control box (1), a heel switch (2), which, when opened, during the oscillation, the shunt resistance (3) and the supply of a stimulation current via the stimulation electrodes (4). When the switch is closed while standing, it connects the shunt resistor across the output of the stimulator, with no stimulus delivered to the stimulation electrodes. Thus, the delivery of the stimulus to the electrodes (positioned to stimulate the fibularis / peroneus communis) will be triggered when the heel switch opens when the heel lifts, while it is closed when the switch closes when the heel hits. Thus, the application of the stimulus is synchronized with the swing phase of the gait. This is an example of a hardwired stimulator where the functionality of the stimulator is determined by the wiring of the electronic circuitry. The system performed the essential task of introducing dorsiflexion in the subject's hemiphlegic foot to the correct point in the gait cycle. Indeed  the functionality of the system was clearly lacking in fineness, providing the stimuli in a crude manner compared to the natural function of the neuromuscular foot lifting system. DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF PREFERRED EMBODIMENTS THE INVENTION Based on5-7A first embodiment will be described which is not part of the invention but useful for understanding the invention. How out5As can be seen, the system comprises an implantable multi-channel stimulator with a multi-pole nerve stimulation electrode that can be implanted on the fibular / peroneal nerve. Further, it has an external unit that powers and controls the implant based on an external switch located under the heel of the user. The heel switch causes the stimulation to be turned on during the gait during the swinging phase of the affected leg and turned off during the stance phase to cause the dorsiflexor muscles to actively lift the foot off the floor during the swing and relax the dorsiflexor muscles during standing. This reduces the risk of line breakage. multipolar Nerve stimulation electrode The Stimulation electrode can have many different constructions. The contacts should be arranged like this be that different parts of the nerve are activated when electrical Electricity is passed through it. In a preferred embodiment a nerve cuff electrode is used, which in principle is a tube of an insulating material (such as silicone) of a number the inside of the tube arranged metal contacts (such as platinum, Platinum / iridium or stainless steel). The tube is on one side open, to enable that it is mounted around the nerve, using a locking mechanism is used to subsequently close the cuff. In a preferred embodiment, a silicone cuff is used with 12 platinum electrode contacts arranged as four tripoles in the cuff. The external contacts of each tripole are shorted to a wire located in the cuff wall, leaving only eight wires to leave the cuff. In a preferred embodiment, the cuff is about 20 mm long and has an inside diameter that is approximately 20% larger than the nerve (typically 5.2 mm). The coils are equipped with a device with batteries, with a Control circuitry and with a power amplifier for Power supply of the coupling loop connected. The unit has inputs for the power of a battery, for a Signal from a heel switch and for a serial input channel for the Programming pacing parameters into the unit. One Receiver, built by the inventors was based on one of the miniature transceiver circuits, those commercially available in those years (eg, from RF Monolithics, Inc.) available become. The Recording a gradual increase / decrease is important for many the patient, because the simple sudden on and off stimulation frequently causes the ankle plantarflexor to or ankle dorsiflexor muscles triggered a stretch reflex becomes. The reflex is caused by too fast movement of the joint and always works the desired Move against. The choice of a suitable speed of the gradual Rise / fall for each of the activated channels can eliminate this reflex. In a present embodiment becomes the stimulation intensity while the swing phase of the leg (after the gradual increase on the specified Level) kept constant while it is in a future embodiment prove useful can, the strength while the swing phase as well as for change a short period of time after foot-to-floor contact. If the stimulation intensity during a Part of the oscillation phase is reduced, potential fatigue and Complaints of stimulation can be reduced. Furthermore, it may be useful the stimulation intensity for one short time after the heel has touched the ground to increase to the mechanical effects of the reaction force of the soil, the upward on the heel acts to counteract that cause can make the front part of the foot faster than the user preferably comes down. apart from the "advanced" programming unit can for the patients are provided with a box that is inside a limited range set by the therapist simple way (eg with a rotary knob or with a slider) the stimulation intensity and / or the balance between turning inwards and turning away can adjust. This user interface may be good many or all set the stimulation parameter, but the user only one or two buttons should have to adjust. An intelligent routine in the programming unit provides then on the basis of the user command the specific parameters. Heel switch with / without radio transmitter In the first preferred embodiment the stimulation is controlled by a sensor that is in the shoe of the User is arranged. This sensor can be a standard heel switch be that with a cable with the power and stimulus control unit is connected, or may be another type of sensor, the information about the Foot-ground contact gives. Further, the cable may be through a wireless communication link be replaced. In this first preferred embodiment, the switching means has been implemented as a wearable garment attached to the user's ankle. At a location under the heel, an ultrathin sensor (in this case a force sensitive resistor from Interlink Electronics, Inc.) is sewn into the garment. This sensor could also be made of a piezoelectric thin film, which has the advantage that it can provide power for parts of the electronic circuit or for the entire electronic circuit in the device. The garment has a compact unit over the ankle containing a battery, a transmitter (from RF Monolithics, Inc.) and a standard microcontroller. Normally, the microcontroller is in a "sleep mode" in which it consumes very little energy. When the user either steps on the sensor or releases the weight from it, the controller wakes up, sends an identification number (to avoid interference with other, similar systems in the area), and then sends one of two possible codes (one for heel strike and one one for heel lift) to the power and stimulus control unit and then returns to sleep. The combination of a portable garment with the sewn-in device, wireless communication with the power and control box, and the fact that the sensor is very thin made it possible  It is clear that the user wears it all day long, even when changing clothes and footwear to choose virtually any type of footwear and go even without shoes. EXAMPLE 1 Three hemiphlegic patients were equipped with the above first embodiment. It was examined whether the system could produce dorsiflexion and whether the multi-channel stimulation electrode placed on the fibular / peroneal above the knee could ensure good selectivity to control the various foot movements. By properly balancing the different stimulation channels, it was possible to create a foot movement that was almost pure dorsiflexion, which is the natural movement and thus cosmetically most acceptable and least damaging to the ankle during the gait.7Figure 11 shows an example of the torques measured about the ankle of a human subject with a 12-pole nerve cuff electrode implanted near the fibularis / peroneus near the knee. The foot was fixed during the measurements and the isometric torques generated around the ankle were registered while the stimulation intensity was increased from zero to maximum over a period of 5 seconds (pulse width 0-250 μs, current 1 mA, frequency 20 Hz). In7It can be seen that the effect of the stimulation on the different channels was quite different, which shows a good selectivity of the cuff electrode and shows that the nerve fibers in the nerve bundle were functionally organized. Channel A for low pacing levels produced a combination of dorsiflexion and inward rotation that changed at high pacing levels for outward rotation. Channel B produced a combination of dorsiflexion and outward rotation. Channels C and D produced a combination of outward rotation and plantar flexion for low levels that changed for higher levels for dorsiflexion. During gait, relatively low torques are required to produce motion, and by selecting a combination of the strengths in the different channels (in this case, by combining channel 1 and 2), it was possible to produce a natural dorsiflexion of the foot. which felt comfortable for the patient. Based on8thA second embodiment will now be described, which does not form part of the invention, but is useful for understanding the invention. Compared to the in5As shown, the heel counter in this system has been replaced by a system for utilizing the natural activity of sensory nerves registered by a peripheral nerve going to the foot. Since many of the parts for the second embodiment are the same as those for the first embodiment, only the parts in FIG8ththat are different from those in5are described. sensory Nerve of the foot The Nerve information about the foot-to-floor contact are found in several of the nerves that innervate the foot skin. It can be expected that the best source of such signals is the Are nerves that innervate the plantar surface. Indeed The inventors have also found that nerves affect other areas of the foot innervate, provide enough information that they are taken and for the control of the stimulator can be used. signals from the heel bone branch of the tibialis (which innervates the skin on the heel) have been registered by being just proximal to the ankle joint a nerve cuff electrode has been implanted on it [Upshaw and Sinkjaer (1998) Digital signal processing algorithms for the detection of afferent nerve activity recorded from cuff electrodes, IEEE Trans. Rehabilitation Engineering, Vol. 6, No. 2, 172-181]. This gives a good signal, but with surgical access to the nerve For this Nerve too difficult to be a good candidate for a commercial system to be. Of the Suralis is a better candidate because of surgical access to it is much easier for him. Furthermore he gives a signal that is as good as that of the heel bone nerve has been registered. Both signals clearly modulate with the Gait cycle, and it is possible from these signals the heel impact and in most cases also to capture the heel lift. To the Suralis can easily few Centimeters proximal to the outer malleolus, where he is immediately under the skin, access to be obtained. For surgical reasons, it is even better if the signals can be registered much further proximal, preferably proximal to the knee. This may be possible because a branch of the fibularis / peroneus communis is in contact with the suralis (Suralis junction branch (67)). This branch is found immediately adjacent to the site where the stimulation electrode is implanted, that is, the registration electrode can be implanted through the same surgical incision. Registration nerve electrode The nerve registration electrode can be constructed in several ways. The common feature is that they have one or more electri  having contacts arranged in or around the nerve such that the naturally occurring activity can be registered either as the sum of the activity on all nerve fibers or as the sum of the activity of a portion of the nerve fibers or as the activity of a single nerve fiber. In a preferred embodiment a nerve cuff electrode has been chosen, in principle a tube of an insulating material (such as silicone) with a Number of arranged on the inside of the tube metal contacts. The tube is open on one side, to enable that it is mounted around the nerve, using a locking mechanism is used to subsequently close the cuff. Of the Nerve cuff of the inventor has three inner circumferential electrodes (made of platinum or stainless steel), which are symmetrical in the cuff (one in the middle and one at each end) are. Furthermore it has an external electrode on the outside of the cuff is arranged and used as a reference. The A method of registering nerve activity with such an electrode has been described in the literature. It provides a signal that a weighted sum of activity in all nerve fibers in The cuff is and gives a good suppression of noise outside of the cuff. Furthermore is in chronic implants both in animals and in humans been shown that it over long periods gives stable signals. implanted amplifier and implanted telemetry device Of the Purpose of this unit is the reinforcement of the with the registration electrode registered nerve signal and its transmission through the skin to the external nerve signal receiver. Depending on the type of registration electrode, it can be different Be implemented. You should get the signal from the registration electrode reinforce with an appropriate amount and optionally a certain amount Signal conditioning (such as bandpass filtering, rectification and / or Integration), before sending the signal through the skin. In a specific embodiment this is implemented with a standard instrumentation amplifier which has the signal approximating 120 dB amplified and transmits the signal through frequency modulation of the carrier signal via a coupling loop. It has a bandwidth of 10 kHz. He is using a separate coupling loop powered by the external power transmitter and signal receiver. The two coupling loops send signals through the same space and are decoupled by a technique known as morphognostic coils. In short, this technique relies on the coils being shaped like this are that the summed magnetic flux from a coupling loop, the goes through the coils of the other, is zero. This is done by that the coils of the power loop are square shaped, while the coils of the signal loop are shaped like an 8. Continue to work the two loops with separate frequencies. power stations and signal receiver These Unit forms the external part for the implanted amplifier and for the implanted telemetry device. It represents an oscillating magnetic field from which the implant gets its performance, and it receives from the magnetic field that transmits the amplified nerve signal to the implant. This latter magnetic field is absorbed by a coil that adapted to the implanted transmitter coil, the resulting electrical signal is demodulated to extract the nerve signal. signal analysis Of the The purpose of the signal analysis unit is the transmission of the registered Nerve signal into a signal that simulates that of a heel switch, if this would have been arranged in the user's shoe. This can be implemented in different ways. Most successful is the following to this day. preprocessing: To remove artifacts caused by electromyographic signals (EMG) from nearby muscles, and the contents of electrode and amplifier noise To reduce the nerve signal is bandpass filtered. The filter cutoff frequencies be based on the optimization of the signal-to-noise ratio using signals with known contents to signal and Noise selected. Then the signal is rectified and integrated. To the takes place from the stimulation pulses coming artefacts takes place the integration between the stimulation pulses in sections in such a way that the integrated sections those times, exclude pacing artefacts. This is a box integration called technique. The resulting signal has a much lower bandwidth than the original one Nerve signal and represents the average amplitude of the nerve signal between each Stimulation pulse. This processing can be done either with an analogue or with a digital circuit arrangement. In any Case, the signal must be in a digitized format from preprocessing come. Foot-to-floor contact detection: The digitized preprocessed nerve signal is fed to an adaptive logic network (ALN, available from Dendronic Decisions, Ltd.), which is a type of  artificial neural network. This type of network is described in the literature and consists of a number of so-called linear threshold units and a number of logic nodes. Because of the logic of the network, it is very easy to implement in a portable device such as the microcontroller described above. The network takes as input a number of parameters derived from the preprocessed nerve signal and produces as output a signal that can be used to turn the stimulator on and off. The network is trained by a supervised learning technique that requires the sequence of data to be registered by the patient during the walk. During this episode, the patient is equipped with sensors under the foot. A lot of data is passed to the ALN with the corresponding nerve signal and sensor signal, and the training algorithm optimizes the network to generate an output signal from the nerve signal that matches the registered sensor signal. When this is done, the artificial sensors under the foot can be removed, with the ALN controlling the stimulator solely on the basis of the nerve signal. If registrations are made from more than one nerve (eg from the tibialis and from the suralis or from the suralis junction branch), it is possible to gather information about how the foot lands on the floor, e.g. For example, whether it lands on the lateral or on the middle aspect of the sole of the foot, because of different branches of the tibialis compared to the suralis47other areas of the sole of the foot (lateral branch48, Heelbone branches49and middle branch50, please refer4innervate). This information can then be used to automatically regulate the relative stimulation levels to correct for excessive inward rotation or outward rotation of the foot. Similarly, stimulation levels may be increased to provide better dorsiflexion to cause the foot to land first with the heel if it is detected that the foot first lands with the front. Based on9Now, a third embodiment in accordance with the invention will be described. This system combines the stimulation and registration electrodes in one. This significantly reduces the amount of operation to be performed and reduces the complexity of the implant. This can be done because the fibularis / peroneal contains skin fibers (sensory fibers) that go to the foot, and since it has been proven that it is possible to register information from these sensors with the nerve cuff stimulation electrode described above. The registered signal clearly modulates with the gait cycle and can be translated into a stimulator control signal in the same manner as described in the second preferred embodiment. Compared to those in the5and8thAs shown, most of this third system is the same except that the sensor electrode and its cable are missing and that the amplifier and stimulator are built into the same device. As a result, the external equipment is simplified because only one power sensor is necessary. Multipole nerve stimulation and registration electrode These Electrode can be constructed in several ways. Indeed the design must meet both the requirements for the registration electrode as well as for fulfill the stimulation electrode. The same as in the second embodiment described multipolar nerve cuff is suitable for this purpose. Implanted multichannel stimulator and nerve signal amplifier These Unity can be implemented in several ways. Basically it's just a combination of the stimulator and the amp, based on of the first and second embodiments have been. However, it necessarily has a switch arrangement, the electrode between either with the stimulator or with the amplifier can switch connected. Preferably This unit should contain the pre-processing as above with respect to the second embodiment as this is the necessary bandwidth for the implanted Transmitter greatly reduced. If the stimulator with digital electronics is implemented, it allows be, information about to store the parameters of pre-processing, so that these the specific conditions of the particular patient, the particular Nerve, the special electrode, etc. can be adjusted. Besides that is it then possible send out the signal in digital form and thereby the effect the loss of signal quality in the transmission through the skin. In addition, with the stimulator and the amplifier connected in this way, it is possible to send further information from the implant to the external unit via the same coupling loop as it transmits the amplitude of the nerve signal. This information could be z. B. impedance measurements of the electrodes (to check their integrity), information about the humidity in the enclosure (to warn of a potential malfunction of the device), information on the coupling coefficients between the  external and implanted coils (to facilitate the placement of the external unit), information about communication errors (acknowledgment exchange), etc. If selective registrations of the different amounts of electrodes in the electrode assembly, it is possible to obtain information about that to grasp how the foot is on the Ground lands, z. B. whether he is on the lateral or middle aspect the sole of the foot lands. This information can then for used automatic regulation of relative stimulation levels be an excessive inward rotation or outward turn of the foot to correct. Similar can the stimulation levels be increased if it is determined that the foot with the front part first lands, allowing a better dorsiflexion is obtained to cause the foot to land first with the heel. EXAMPLE 2 As described below, the inventors have demonstrated a dermal nerve signal from the foot using it Electrode, as for the stimulation of the nerve for the dorsiflexion of the foot was registered by the fibularis / peroneal nerve proximal to the knee can. Furthermore it has been proven that it is possible to use this signal simultaneously to register while stimulated by the same cuff. method When Part of the procedure for the exam the implantable equiniposition stimulator developed by the inventors Three hemiphlegic patients were present at the fibularis / peroneus communis a few inches proximal to the knee with a 12-pole nerve cuff electrode (20 mm long, 5.2 mm ID) instrumented. The eight lead wires to the Electrodes were used for an 8 week start period taken from the skin. This procedure enabled in this initial period a direct electrical access to the cuff. One of the patients (female, 32 years old) also had a nerve cuff located on the suralis proximal to the ankle and an implantable enhancer placed subcutaneously in the mid-thigh10that the sciatic nerve100, the Suralis101, the fibularis / peroneus102, the implanted amplifier103for strengthening the suralis signal, the suralis cuff electrode104, the fibular / peroneal cuff electrode105and the percutaneous wires106from the fibularis / peroneal cuff electrode. To enable it to register and pace through the same cuff electrode, an electronic circuit was built, see11coming from a personal computer110, from a stimulator111, from an optically coupled field effect transistor112, from the electrode113, from an amplifier114which amplifies the signal via a Fermessungsverbindung115to a corresponding recipient116sent, and from a bandpass filter117which filtered the signal to between 600 Hz to 2500 Hz. While a pulse was being delivered to the amplifier in the intervals between pulses, the circuit switched the electrodes to the stimulator through an output from the stimulator118controlled by. The switches were fabricated by optically coupled field effect transistors because they produced very little switching noise (no charge injection through a gate capacitance). In addition, they had no galvanic connection between the switched signal and the control signal, which caused them to have very little effect on the common mode rejection characteristics of the amplifier. A more conventional way to achieve this would be to use transformer coupling, but transformers are inherently bulky and would be difficult to use in an implantable device. The stimulator generated charge-balanced current-controlled pulses (1 mA, 0-255 μs pulse width). The PC controlled the stimulator and felt the amplified nerve signal and processed it. Of course, the embodiment described above is merely a laboratory test model that would be miniaturized for subsequent implementation by incorporating the receiving and filtering means, the computing means, and the stimulator into a small and lightweight device that could easily be e.g. B. attached to the upper arm of a patient or can be worn in a belt. Furthermore, the stimulation signals and the power would be used to drive the electrodes113and thus the associated circuitry using a Fermessungsverbindung, as between the amplifier114and the receiver116shown is also supplied to the implanted part of the system. Furthermore, the circuit arrangement can the electrodes113and the external components of the system for encoding and decoding the signals as described above. 12shows an example of the raw signal that has been registered during stimulation. The combined stimulation artifacts and switching noise lasted short enough (10 ms) to allow a sufficiently long window between them to register the nerve signal. 13shows data registered by the fibularis / peroneal nerve cuff during gait (without stimulation). The upper signal track  is the rectified and box-integrated suralis signal130which is included for comparison only. The second signal track is the corresponding fibularis / peroneus signal131, For reference, the ankle angle132(registered by a Penny & Giles goniometer) and signals registered by force-sensitive resistors (FSRs) under the foot on the heel134and at the middle135and lateral133Metatarsus were shown. It is clear that the Fibularis / Peronäus signal modulated synchronously with the gait cycle and had similar features to the Suralis signal. It was then investigated whether the signal processing algorithm could be applied to the decoupling of a stimulator control signal to the Fibularis / Peronus signal based on an Adaptive Logic Network (ALN). This type of network is described in the literature and consists of a number of so-called linear threshold units and of a number of logic nodes [A. Kostov, BJ Andrews, DB Popovic, RB Stein, WW Armstrong (1995) Machine learning in control of functional electrical stimulation systems for locomotion IEEE Trans. Biomedical Engineering, Vol. 42, No. 6, pp. 541-551]. Because of the logic nature of the network, it is very easy to implement in a portable device such as the microcontroller described above. The last signal track136in13shows the result of it. The network was trained at 50 seconds level walking and rated at a further 50 seconds level walking. The comparison of the target signal received from the FSR with the output of the ALN provided correct samples as high as those obtained using the Suralissignals. 14shows results from the simultaneous stimulation and registration of the same cuff. The subject sat down. In the11The circuit shown was connected to a set of electrodes in the fibularis / peroneal cuff. The first row140shows the stimulation intensity (pulse width in microseconds, current = 1 mA, frequency = 25 Hz). The second row141shows the output from a force sensor (uncalibrated) held by hand to the back of the foot to give an indication of the effect of the stimulation. The third row142shows the rectified and box-integrated fibularis / peroneal signal (in microvolts). The fourth row143shows a touch sensor (uncalibrated) that was used to manually pace the skin to give an indication of when sensor signals should be expected. The data in the first column144were registered when there was no stimulation and no skin contact. Thus, the registered signal represented the background activity of the system. In the second column145The foot was touched in the skin innervation area of the fibularis / peroneal, modulating the registered nerve signal accordingly. In the third column146Stimulation was applied by the cuff, but the skin was not touched. This gave a small increase in the nerve signal corresponding to the toe movement caused by the change in stimulation intensity, but no apparent change that could be directly linked to the stimulation artifacts. In the fourth column147The fibularis / peroneal was stimulated by the cuff and touched the skin. It can be seen that it was still possible to obtain from the nerve a clear nerve signal that modulated in agreement with the skin, even when the same nerve was stimulated with the same electrode. Conclusions It it has been proven that it is possible to have a peripheral Nerve to stimulate and over a single set of electrodes that multiplexes fast enough to be functional at the same time, natural sensor information to register from this nerve. This can be done in a number of applications, where a natural Sensor feedback Adding power to a nerve prosthesis can be very useful. Further it has been proven that it is possible to provide gear-related information from the fibularis / peroneus over the Knee register and use to send a control signal generate a fibularis / peroneal stimulator for the Correction of a Spitzfußstellung to control.

title: System for parental control in video programs based on multimedia content information
abstract: A parental control system provides the ability to automatically filter a multimedia program content in real time based on stock and user specified criteria. The criteria are used to teach a learning module in the system what types of video program segments are to be considered sensitive or objectionable so that the module's understanding of what is sensitive and what is not can be applied to other video programs to provide real-time filtering. The multimedia program is broken down into audio, video, and transcript components so that sound effects, visual components and objects, and language can all be analyzed collectively to make a determination of whether offending material is being passed along in the multimedia program. The user has the option of training the system for any type of objectionable material, not just sex and violence.

title: Non-bridged single electrode impedance measurement system for determining a condition of a dielectric according to impedance related changes over a range of frequencies
abstract: A method and system for analyzing the state of a dielectric material is disclosed. The dielectric material is determined to be in a state, S, by determining a similarity or dissimilarity between: (a) a first set of impedance values derived from excitation of a capacitor having the dielectric material disposed between electrodes for the capacitor, and (b) a second set of predetermined corresponding impedance values indicative of the state S. For each of a plurality of electrical frequencies, there are corresponding impedance values in the first and second sets. Each such impedance values is one of a conductance and a capacitance value for the dielectric material. Thus, within a time period sufficiently short so that the dielectric material is expected to remain in a same state throughout the time period, each of the electrical frequencies is used to excite the capacitor, and corresponding response impedance values are derived that provide an impedance “snap shot” of the dielectric material. Accordingly, a most likely state for the dielectric material is determined from a similarity or dissimilarity between the snap shot (i.e. the first set hereinabove), and the second of predetermined corresponding impedance values for the state.

title: Method and apparatus for the design and analysis of market research studies
abstract: This invention automates the most common processes in market research study design and analysis. By combining a database framework designed to hold all the data elements used in a market research survey, codifying heuristics actually used by analysts to make decisions about survey analysis, and building a lexicon to communicate summary results to lay readers. First, this provides a stringent framework for designing a questionnaire and study plan which will lead to clear tab plans and analysis plans. Second, by automating the research design and analysis process, it eliminates the human error associated with the intricacies of questionnaire design, tab plan design, and research report writing. Thirdly, it also greatly reduces the time necessary to rerun an entire report based on simple changes to any study element definitions to a few hours, a process formerly taking days or weeks. Lastly, it reduces the need for experienced researchers in the research design and analysis process, freeing analysts to spend a greater proportion of their time working on the more mentally challenging and demanding work of synthesizing the market research survey to produce credible findings, rather than the redundant work of data tabulation and summary reporting.

title: COMPUTER-ASSISTED CONFIGURATOR FOR CONFIGURING AN INVESTMENT OF THE FOUNDRY INDUSTRY
abstract: A configuration unit (7) links component and/or plant data contained in a data structure together with user-specific data and/or specifications optimally based on prestored models describing plants and/or processes in basic material industry and outputs the configured product in the form of a structured configuration proposal. <??>Independent claims are also included for the following: <??>(1) E-business platform; <??>(2) method for computer-aided planning of plant in basic material industry; and <??>(3) configurator operating method.

title: System to automatically detect eye corneal striae
abstract: An automated eye corneal striae detection system for use with a refractive laser system includes a cornea illuminator, a video camera interface, a computer, and a video display for showing possible eye corneal striae to the surgeon. The computer includes an interface to control the corneal illuminator, a video frame grabber which extracts images of the eye cornea from the video camera, and is programmed to detect and recognize eye corneal striae. The striae detection algorithm finds possible cornea striae, determines their location, or position, on the cornea and analyzes their shape. After all possible eye corneal striae are detected and analyzed, they are displayed for the surgeon on an external video display. The surgeon can then make a determination as to whether the corneal LASIK flap should be refloated, adjusted or smoothed again.

title: Automatic celebrity face matching and attractiveness rating machine
abstract: The present invention teaches an amusement machine having the abilities of automatically finding the most likely match of a user facial image to a prestored database of facial images such as celebrity images and in estimating the degree of attractiveness of the user facial image. The amusement machine has a camera11for taking a facial image of the user, automatically compares it to said prestored database of facial images, and assigns the attractiveness score. The results are then displayed to the user on a computer screen13.

title: Routing call failures in a location-based services system
abstract: A method and system for routing call failures in a location-based services system. A remote terminal is connected to a location-based services system and is used to generate a voice-based tailored request for information. The voice-based tailored request for information is interpreted with a voice recognition application and a natural language processing application. If the voice recognition application or the natural language processing application fail to determine the meaning of the tailored request for information to a predetermined level of accuracy then the remote terminal is routed to a call center.

title: Card shuffler device with automatic card size calibration
abstract: A letter handling device (2) comprising: a letter receiving area (6, 106) for receiving an initial group of letters; a letter collecting area (150) for receiving letters from the letter receiving area (106); a movable letter collecting surface (14, 156) in the letter collecting area (150); a letter shifting system for shifting letters from the letter receiving area (106) to the letter collecting area (150), the received letters forming a pile of letters on the letter collecting surface (156); at least one stationary letter support member (154) located within the letter collection area (150) to support at least one letter in the letter collection area (150); and a processor (160) to randomly determine a card insertion point in the card stack for a card, to lower the card pickup surface (14,156) and thereby create the card insertion point and then command the device place the card at the randomly determined card insertion point.

title: Hearing aid with automatic switching to Hasp coil operation
abstract: Hearing aid (1) withan acoustic pickup (2, 3) for receiving an acoustic signal,an induction sensor (4) for receiving an induction signal anda control device (5) for controlling the hearing device (1),marked bya classification device for examining whether the induction signal and the acoustic signal are each a useful signal, anda comparison device for comparing the recorded acoustic signal with the recorded induction signal on the basis of the useful signal examination and supplying a comparison result to the control device (5) for controlling the hearing device on the basis of the comparison result.

title: Spell checking for text input via reduced keypad keys
abstract: Spell checking of a word corresponding to a typically numeric key sequence entered by the user using numeric keys or other reduced keyboards is disclosed. The spell checking is based on comparisons of the entered number sequences with number sequences within a dictionary, or number sequences for words within a dictionary. For a given entered number sequence, the number sequences of words in a dictionary, or the number sequences in the dictionary, are compared. Those having costs according to a metric not greater than a maximum cost are presented as the potential intended word of the user. The metric may be the minimum edit distance, for example.

title: Multilane vehicle information capture system
abstract: A system and method for accurate express tolling of highway vehicles. A multilane tolling system comprises a tolling (MVIC) unit that collects information from tolling subsystems arranged to take various vehicle measurements. Preferably, an intelligent vehicle identification subsystem sends vehicle information to the MVIC unit many times per second. Preferably, a vision tracking system (VTS) communicates with the MVIC unit and sends the latter information about the vehicle position using vision tracking sensors. Preferably, an RF subsystem conducts multiple reads of a transponder on a passing vehicle and forwards the read information to the MVIC unit. Preferably, a vehicle image capture unit (VICU) captures images of the passing vehicle when a camera in the VICU receives a trigger from the MVIC unit. Preferably, a driver alert module is used alert a driver passing through a tolling point as to account balance associated with a silent toll tag or pay by plate system.

title: Online interaction processing
abstract: Methods and apparatus to process online interactions from numerous sources, coming from different time frames and systems. One embodiment includes a facilitator, an interaction processor, and an action generator. The facilitator facilitates interactions in one or more devices, where interactions typically occur. The processor can consolidate and analyze interactions from multiple sources, in different formats, and collected at different time frames, to extract intelligence from them. The processor processes such interactions, and generates an interaction descriptor for each interaction. A descriptor can include a generalization of the corresponding interaction, and at least a part of the interaction. Descriptors for different types of interactions can be represented by the same format to allow the processor to analyze them together. The action generator can improve on future interactions; refer an interaction to be responded by a human representative if necessary; and allow users to extract information from the analysis, and generate reports regarding the interactions. Future interactions can then be significantly enhanced, with customers having higher satisfaction level, and companies more accurately charting their future.

title: Customer messaging service
abstract: A messaging and alerting service is described. An implementation includes enrolling a customer in the messaging and alert service, storing a list of businesses selected by the customer, storing a customer contact hierarchy list, and contacting the customer according to the contact hierarchy list. The messaging and alerting service enables real-time, interactive alerts to be delivered to customers in the customer's preferred media. In addition, customers may respond to the alerts to provide important directions to a business.

title: System and method for classifying vehicles
abstract: A system and method have been provided for classifying electronic signatures, obtained through the detection of a vehicle with a single loop inductive sensor, into one of a plurality of vehicle classification groups. A neural networking process is able to learn the plurality of vehicle classifications. In response to an electronic signature stimulus, the neural networking process is able to recall the classification group corresponding to the signature.

title: Apparatus and method for determining compatibility of web sites with designated requirements based on functional characteristics of the web sites
abstract: An apparatus and method for searching a database of web site functional characteristics to identify web sites that are compatible with designated functions are provided. With the apparatus and method, a database of functional characteristics is compiled and a search interface is provided. The database may be compiled in an automatic, manual, or semiautomatic manner by, for example, retrieving web site content with various functions of a web browser disabled and analyzing the resultant output through the web browser. With the search interface, a user may enter designations of the functional characteristics that the user is either interested in having or not having in the resultant list of web sites. Based on the user's designation of functional characteristics, the search engine associated with the search interface searches the database of web sites and identifies the web site entries in the database that are compatible with the designated functional characteristics. The search engine then provides a listing of these web site entries through a search output interface which may then be used by the user that requested the search.

title: Automated, computer-based reading tutoring systems and methods
abstract: An automated, computer-based reading tutoring system is accessed via a computer system and includes a plurality of instructional passages of different, predetermined levels of reading difficulty. A semantic space module of the reading tutoring system operates on a semantic space, which is produced by a machine-learning method, to automatically evaluate a student-submitted summary of a selected instructional passage for congruence with the selected instructional passage and to automatically determine which instructional passage the student should optimally read next. The reading tutoring system includes immediate feedback data provided to the student and including an indicator reflective of the student's reading comprehension and the identity of the instructional passage that the student should read next. An automated, computer-based method of reading tutoring comprises the steps of receiving a student-submitted summary of a selected instructional passage from a domain of discourse, automatically evaluating the summary to obtain a measure of the student's reading comprehension and, based on this evaluation, automatically selecting an instructional passage for the student to read next.

title: Vehicle transmission shift quality
abstract: A vehicle powertrain modelling system includes a powertrain model (20), a vehicle model (30), a seat model (55), a driver model (60) and a correlation element (50) comprising a neural network. As a result vehicle development is enhanced, using the neural network (50) to correlate modelled shift aspects with previous subjectively obtained ratings.

title: Differential LSI space-based probabilistic document classifier
abstract: A computerized method for automatic document classification based on a combined use of the projection and the distance of the differential document vectors to the differential latent semantics index (DLSI) spaces. The method includes the setting up of a DLSI space-based classifier to be stored in computer storage and the use of such classifier by a computer to evaluate the possibility of a document belonging to a given cluster using a posteriori probability function and to classify the document in the cluster. The classifier is effective in operating on very large numbers of documents such as with document retrieval systems over a distributed computer network.

title: Stock market prediction using natural language processing
abstract: A method of using natural language processing (NLP) techniques to extract information from online news feeds and then using the information so extracted to predict changes in stock prices or volatilities. These predictions can be used to make profitable trading strategies. Company names can be recognized and simple templates describing company actions can be automatically filled using parsing or pattern matching on words in or near the sentence containing the company name. These templates can be clustered into groups which are statistically correlated with changes in the stock prices. The system is composed of two parts: message understanding component that automatically fills in simple templates and a statistical correlation component that tests the correlation of these patterns to increases or decreases in the stock price. The methods can be applied to a broad range of text, including articles in online newspapers such as the Wall Street Journal, financial newsletters, radio &TV transcripts and annual reports. In an enhanced embodiment of the system statistical patterns in Internet usage data and Internet data such as newly released textual information on Web pages are further leveraged.

title: COMMON-USED DATA PROCESSING FOR PROCESS CONTROL SYSTEMS
abstract: AREA OF INVENTION The The present invention relates generally to process control systems in Process or processing plants and in particular a data processing system, Internet-based communications uses data processing and computing control options for one To provide variety of processing plants. DESCRIPTION OF THE STATE OF THE ART Process control systems like those in chemical, petroleum or other processing plants typically have one or more centralized or decentralized process control units, those with at least one host or server workstation and with one or more process control and instrumentation devices such as field devices Analog, digital or combined analogue / digital buses communicative are coupled. Field devices, such as valves, valve positioners, Switches, transducers and sensors (eg temperature, pressure and pressure) Flow rate sensors) are lead within the process functions such as opening or closing of Valves and the measurement of process parameters. The process control unit receives Signals that indicate process measurements or process variables, which are determined by the field devices or assigned to them, and / or uses other information concerning the field devices this information for implementing a control routine and then generates control signals via one or more of the buses are sent to the field devices to to control the process flow. Information from the field devices and the control unit will typically be one or more Applications available provided by an operator workstation, to carry out an operator desired To allow functions in relation to the process, such as viewing the current process status, a modification of the process flow etc. The increasing number and size of power generation plants, industrial processing plants, room air systems on coal or petroleum base (HVAC systems), devices and instruments etc. significantly pollutes the environment and makes the monitoring and analysis of the measurements made in process control systems of residential complexes, Commercial and industrial areas are carried out, more important. As a result, the increasing competition as well as legal constraints such as aggravated Environmental regulations have led to environmental impact and pollution minimization, environmental safety, operational safety and improved energy efficiency of process control activities within a business to a significant source of profit for the Have become operators of processing plants. Of course it includes the improvement of the profit situation also the avoidance of penalties, Legal proceedings and other costs associated with non-compliance the environmental laws, the regulatory Regulations, safety regulations, etc. One particularly important area of regulations includes the laws, the dangerous pollutant emissions of processing plants to limit. As is well known, these efficiency-based cost reductions result from the fact that the efficient operation of an operation is very dependent on the state of the facilities within the facility and the timing of maintenance on these facilities. Become conventional the performance monitoring devices Uses tools such as input / output algorithms, models, etc., to determine how efficiently an operation works and / or whether through changes during maintenance operations, by replacement of used equipment, modification of facilities, etc. a more cost-effective process can be achieved can. Therefore, you can Typically, relatively small processors typically have the significant Investments do not contribute to the implementation of the customer Analytical instruments or systems are required, and can consequently the improvement of operating efficiency and other benefits that do not realize themselves through these systems. One Although the typical process control system has many process control and instrumentation devices such as valves, transmitters, Sensors, etc., with one or more process control units connected to the software that runs these devices while the process flow controls; however, there are many other supporting devices, which also for the process flow is necessary or related. This extra Devices are, for example, power supply devices, Power generation and distribution equipment, rotating equipment such as turbines, etc., which are typically all within one plant are provided distributed. Create these additional facilities while not necessarily using and becoming process variables in many cases neither controlled by a process control unit nor are they with it coupled to influence the process flow, but these facilities are nevertheless important and ultimately indispensable for the proper functioning of the organization Process. Persons responsible for applications used for business applications, such as ordering parts, supplies, raw materials, etc., and strategic business decisions, such as the choice of products to produce, the in-store optimization variables etc., are typically located in office premises that are remote from both the process control interfaces and the maintenance interfaces. Similarly, managers or other persons may wish to have access to certain information within the processing plant from remote locations or from other computer systems associated with the processing plant for use in operational overview and long-term strategic decision-making. Unfortunately, the fact that the communication links typically used with conventional analytical instrument systems are protected makes it difficult or nearly impossible for authorized users to gain access to important process control data from a remote terminal  get away from the place. Specifically, the remote user wishing to communicate with analytical instrument systems typically needs to use a computer platform that has their own software copies to communicate using the proprietary communication protocol of the instrumentation and process control system of a particular processing plant. The data servers used in conjunction with the shared computing device described herein may utilize any desired data compression technique to minimize bandwidth consumption without sacrificing data content or data accuracy. Additionally or alternatively, the embedded data servers234.235and242used in internet-enabled smart field devices210and212, the internet enabled field device interface224and / or the web server218to use data compression to minimize bandwidth consumption. By way of example only, data compression techniques may be performed using well known techniques such as transmission of exceptions (ie, insignificant data changes are not transmitted), Fourier or wavelet transmission, transmitting frequency domain coefficients reconstituted by the receiving device to the original real time signal, etc. Of course, all could other known or yet to be developed data compression techniques, without departing from the scope of the invention. The shared data processing device described herein may employ various data correction techniques to correct sensor deviations (ie, degradation of sensor accuracy over time) and sensor failure. The redundant data server110to114in the shared data processing device100may execute applications that provide for automatic digital verification, data validation, reconciliation, and periodic or event triggered automatic data source recalibration (for sensors or other devices equipped with this capability). Furthermore, the data processing device shared by the computer100The data correction applications of the present invention have failure and deviation detection circuits and / or logic that detect when a sensor or device has deviated beyond (or is about to deviate) beyond the self-correction range. In response to detection of such an underflow or overflow condition, the failure and deviation detection circuitry and / or logic may perform a 'bumpless' measurement substitution, wherein the last known good measurement from the failing sensor or device to a redundant sensor or sensor a redundant device is transmitted, and may then generate an alarm message for the failed o the failing device. Of course, more complex data correction or substitution procedures such as a neural network model or correlation model may be used instead. In either case, the shared computing device may then utilize diagnostic information pertaining to the failed sensor or failed device to autonomously request or trigger the required maintenance for that failed sensor or device. In instances where a sensor does not have an automatic recalibration capability, the shared computing device described herein may utilize redundant measurements, heat flow and mass balances, and / or process models to develop correction factors applied to measurements taken by inaccurate sensors and other devices thereby avoiding the need for immediate removal, replacement or maintenance of these devices. To simplify the data correction capabilities of the shared computing device described herein, the various data servers used in the system may include, for example, the embedded servers234.235and242, the data compression nodes214and216and the redundant servers110to114Add timestamp and data quality parameters to data between an operation and the shared computing device100be transmitted. The shared computing device described herein can be used to cost effectively make many different complex applications available to a large number of customers, geographically distant large businesses owned by a single business entity, smaller industrial or commercial businesses in a single location, and even small process systems for Wohnanla  (eg residential energy generation and management applications). One particularly important industrial operation application of the shared computing device described herein relates to the collection and reporting of continuous emissions monitoring data (CEMD). For example, the shared computing device described herein may compare CEMD from a particular plant (or facilities) to predetermined operating limits or environmental protection agency (EPA) limits and may use one or more warnings, alerts, and / or reports generate the CEMD. In particular, if certain EPA emission limits are exceeded (or near a threshold and will soon exceed it), a warning or alarm message may be automatically sent by the shared computing device to the operations management, government agencies, and so on. If desired, the alarm messages may be routed to automatically dispatch a service person or other person who may be capable of examining and / or correcting the predicted or current condition causing the alarm. Such alerts may be transmitted using e-mail messages, pager messages, or any other desired reporting mechanism. Alternatively or additionally, the shared computing device described herein may transmit emission data to asset management and / or government regulatory authorities using a previously approved format. Since the collaborative computing device can generate alarm messages indicating that there is a danger of exceeding an emission limit and can send these messages to an asset manager or operator, it is possible that the asset manager or operator may avoid a potentially costly non-compliance with a government policy , In addition to providing alert or alarm messages in response to emission levels that exceed or are about to exceed regulatory limits, the collaborative computing device may also be used for environmental management, using the collaborative computing device optimization applications to minimize soiling levels (in the Contrast to a mere warning that such values are close to limits or exceed legal limits). For example, CEMD may be used to provide input values for a common vector gradient technique, a neural network technique, and / or a Fibonacci search technique for operational emission optimization and operational emission minimization. Thus, the shared computing device described herein may serve to provide alert functions as well as control functions that include balancing control or automatic safety shutdown of an operation and optimization of operating processes, thereby minimizing environmental impact and improving the operational safety and integrity of the devices become. More generally, such automatic or balancing control functions can also serve to increase product production rates and quality, which can significantly increase the profitability of the operation. Furthermore, since the shared data processing device using the Internet122plant owners and operators can easily provide online access to operate their facilities for government agencies. In other words, government officials can be empowered to conduct an online survey of the equipment or assets of a particular business entity, thereby avoiding expensive and time-consuming on-site visits. In addition, can the shared data processing device described herein Provide cost accounting and management applications, which the ability of a plant operator or plant owner in relation to the management and improve the control of production or plant operating costs becomes. In some cases may be the shared data processing device Used to provide real-time cost accounting and cost management actions perform, it possible make an operation control parameters or any other operating conditions modified so that the actual current income is maximized, the actual current use of the facilities maximizes, etc. Deliver these costing and cost management applications prefers, though not necessarily, improvising cost information for asset managers or operator instead of just providing information about facilities, by not necessarily having a good understanding of with this furnishing information associated costs. Generally speaking, and in comparison with conventional systems that typically use proprietary communication protocol and custom user interface software, the shared computing device described herein offers extended connectivity to processing companies. The shared data processing described here  processing facility allows any authorized user access to required operating information, analysis results, diagnostic information, emissions data, etc., using virtually any computer platform that is internet browser capable, and access to virtually any hardwired (eg, telephone, cable, etc.) or Radio (eg satellite, mobile, etc.) communication link. Operators, operators, regulators, or other authorized users are therefore able to view real-time operational information associated with particular operations, areas within operations, particular systems or devices within a facility, and so on. Further, the shared computing device described herein may provide these users with a variety of environmental impact reports, operational efficiency reports, energy consumption reports, maintenance information, forecast results, etc., without requiring each operation to incur the overhead costs associated with supporting complex hardware, software, software support personnel, training required, etc , which are typically necessary to carry out these activities. In other words, the shared computing device described herein enables a variety of information to be provided to a variety of customers at a very low cost. For example, an operations manager may use the shared computing device described herein to run, in real time, temperatures, pressures, currents, etc. over a corporate intranet port to any computer (including a portable computer physically remote from the point of operation) that is running a browser can, to look at and to track. In addition, if desired, the operations manager may track the trend of one or more process parameters using a browser applet. Further, a process engineer or operations manager can analyze and track discontinuous process activities and, if desired, request reports detailing a summary of raw material costs, energy costs, a comparison of product quality and cost between processing units, and so on. Consequently may the shared data processing device described here of Small business users will be used, otherwise not in would be able the investment costs, the specialized maintenance staff etc. typically necessary to data processing equipment (i.e., the data acquisition systems, analyzers, communication systems etc.) in the workplace. Instead allows it is the shared data processing device described here a variety of business entities, one centrally managed data processing device via the Shared use of the Internet. In some cases the shared data processing device described herein to be in possession of a business entity and of these are operated, and others, including various business entities, the may have one or more processing plants Data servers, the software and all other facilities that for the use of the shared data processing device are required to lease (eg as an operating lease outside of the business books, as Finance leasing, etc.) or rent. This way one can Business entity which the services of the shared computing device takes advantage of this usage periodically charged based on the size and / or nature of Data delivered to this business entity become. Preferred, but not necessarily, are the periodic ones Costs incurred by the leasing or leasing business entity are significantly lower than the cost of the business unit would arise if they are more like their own computing device capacity acquire and operate. The shared computing device has been described herein as being preferably implemented using one or more software applications; Some or all of the functions performed by these applications may be implemented in hardware, firmware, etc., and may be implemented by any other processor associated with a process control system or operation. Thus, if desired, the elements described herein may be implemented in a standard universal CPU or on specially designed hardware or firmware such as an application specific integrated circuit (ASIC) or other hardwired device. When implemented in software, the software routine may be stored in any computer-readable memory, such as a magnetic disk, laser disk or other storage medium, RAM or ROM of a computer or processor, any database, and so on. Likewise, this software may be provided to a user or process control operation by any known or desired delivery method, including, for example, a computer-readable disk or other portable computer storage mechanism or channel such as a telephone line, the Internet, etc. (these are considered to be the same or replaceable the provision of the software by means of a transportable storage medium considered). Furthermore, one or more different types of data storage may be provided  directions in the history devices and other data storage devices described in connection with the shared data processing device. For example, if desired, a redundant array of low cost disks (RAID) may be used.

title: Unauthorized user prevention device and method
