In response, the ad shows4"Stay calm in a reclining or lying position with your legs motionless." on and the clock25is activated to start counting a predetermined period of time. In this embodiment, the clock counts for five minutes (step S60). Thereafter, the device starts to measure a bioelectrical impedance of the subject (step S61). A calculated bioelectrical impedance value is stored in the memory unit24stored (step S62). Then, it is checked whether the five-minute period has passed or not (step S63), and if not, the process returns to step S61 to continue measuring the bioelectrical impedance. Since the body orientation of the subject has been changed from the standing or sitting position to the reclining position, the body fluid stored in the lower legs may move into the upper body of the body during this period. Therefore, the value of the bioelectrical impedance measured between both feet can gradually increase, as represented by a curve on the left side of FIG1is shown. This is based on the fact that the blood contains much electrolyte, such as sodium ion (Na +) and potassium ion (K +), and thus has a higher conductive property, and when the amount of blood is reduced, then should the impedance value in this range will increase accordingly. At step S63, if the five-minute interval has passed, then an indication to instruct the subject to get up is displayed4appear (step S64). In response, the subject himself puts himself in the standing position and presses the decision / limit switch5e(Step S65). Then the display shows4the instruction, "Stay in place with your feet motionless." and the clock25is activated again to start counting for another specific period of time. The clock25counts at this time for five minutes (step S66). Thereafter, the device starts to measure the bioelectrical impedance of the subject (step S67). The calculated value of bioelectrical impedance is in the memory unit24stored (step S68). Then, it is checked whether the five-minute interval has passed or not (step S69), and if not, the process returns to step S67 to continue measuring the bioelectrical impedance. Since the body direction of the subject has been changed from the reclined position to the standing position, the body fluid containing the blood that is circulated throughout the body will begin to be stored in the lower legs. Therefore, the value of the bioelectrical impedance measured between both feet is gradually reduced as shown by the curve in the middle portion of FIG1will be shown. Initially, the bioelectrical impedance drops rapidly and then shows a gradual decrease as the amount of blood in the lower legs approaches the limit of storage capacity. If the five-minute interval has passed at step S69, an indication to instruct the subject to self-rest on the  display4shown (step S70). In response, the subject puts himself in the reclined position and presses the decision / limit switch5e(Step S71). Then the display shows4the statement "Stay calm in the reclining or lying position with your legs motionless." on and the clock25is activated to begin counting for another particular period of time. The clock25counts at this time for five minutes (step S72). Thereafter, the device starts to measure the bioelectrical impedance of the subject (step S73). The calculated value of bioelectrical impedance is in the memory unit24stored (step S74). Then, it is checked whether the five minute interval has passed or not (step S75), and if not, the process returns to step S74 to continue measuring the bioelectrical impedance. Since the body direction of the subject has been changed from the standing position to the reclining position, the body fluid including the blood stored in the lower legs may begin to move back into the upper body. Therefore, the value of the bioelectrical impedance measured between both feet gradually increases as shown by the curve on the right side of FIG1will be shown. If the five-minute interval has passed at step S75, the measurement of the bioelectric ends Impedance and an arithmetic operation will begin (step S76). In this arithmetic operation, the gradient of a bioelectrical impedance represented by the deviation thereof per unit time is determined for each period of a specific body direction. The θ1, θ2 and θ3 can be calculated from the bioelectrical impedance values, each being measured at the initial moment in each period of the specific body direction (ZA1, ZA2, ZA3) as well as the bioelectrical impedance values, each in the last moment in each period (ZB1, ZB2, ZB3) and the measuring times (T1, T2, T3) are measured by using the above equations (2) - (4). Thus, the calculated θ1, θ2, and θ3 are compared with corresponding reference values included in the memory unit24whereby it is determined whether or not the subject has the condition suitable for developing thrombosis of deep-seated veins. For the purpose of the present invention, the term, respectively corresponding reference values, refers to the gradients of bioelectrical impedance represented by the deviations thereof per unit time for a common healthy person in respective periods of particular body directions. The reference values similar to those in the first embodiment may be modified depending on the sex, the age, or the degree of relevance of a subject regarding the factors involved in the lower leg thrombosis of lower leg veins, and hence the memory unit24a plurality of reference values are stored for each period of a particular body orientation. If the thus calculated θ1 or θ3 is lower than its reference value and θ2 is greater than its reference value, which has a larger storage capacity in the Indicating lower legs, then it can be said that the subject has the condition that is suitable thrombosis of low-lying veins to develop. Consequently, the comparisons of the gradients of the three impedances performed to see if the θ1 and θ3 fallen to or lower than the reference levels or not, and if the θ2 fallen or greater than the reference value or not, and it determines how far the conditions have been met are, in which case all fulfilled three conditions are, then as a level 0, in the event that one of the conditions is not Fulfills is, then as a level 1, in the event that two of the conditions are not Fulfills are, as a level 2, and in the case that all three states are not Fulfills are when a level 3 is specified. The ad4indicates the level representing the specific result (step S77). Farther becomes a communication or advice regarding the procedure for preventing the development of thrombosis of low-lying veins a lower leg also displayed (step S78). This advice can include those described with reference to the first embodiment previously presented and are thus omitted herein. Then the subject can print the particular result and advice on a sheet of paper. When the pressure switch5fis pressed (step S79), the printer performs6the printing operation by and ejects the printed sheet of paper (step S80). After completion of the printing operation or after a predetermined period of time in the case of non-pressing of the pressure switch5fhas passed, the display disappears on the display4to stop the whole process of the operation, and the power or the power is also turned off. Some of the preferred embodiments of the present invention were as described above, but wherein the reference value of the bioelectrical impedance (reference BI), which in the description of the first embodiment is shown, has been used only by way of example and the reference BI may be suitably modified, in addition to the Gender and age, a set of personal physical information, like a body fat ratio or a BMI (body mass index). This is based on the fact that from a fatigued subject, that a relatively larger fat mass typically smaller muscle mass and inevitably have a worse ability to pump the muscular action effective or effective. Furthermore may, although in the illustrated embodiments, the reference has been described in the storage unit in a kind or to be stored in a mode consisting of a plurality of values exists, a similar one Effect can be obtained in an alternative way of the reference value, in which a reference value can be stored in response on the entered personal physical information to be modified, creating a provision to disposal or otherwise instead of modifying the Reference value may be a measured value of bioelectrical impedance in response to the personal corrected physical information and the corrected bioelectric Impedance and the corrected value of the bioelectrical impedance compared with the reference value, whereby a determination of the state or status available is provided. Furthermore can, though the period for restricting the movement of the legs before the measurement as a five-minute interval in the Embodiments illustrated above has been set, the restriction period is made longer so that more Blood can be stored in the lower legs, which is a more accurate or more careful Determination allows whether or not the subject has the condition suitable for thrombosis low-lying veins develop in the area of the lower leg. However, it is not good for either the body of the subject, that some Genuine thrombus by prolonged limitation of the legs in adverse Manner is generated, and so should an appropriate or appropriate Time period can be adjusted by exhaustion or fatigue or Pain of the subject as well as a comfort considered become. Furthermore may, although in the embodiment illustrated above, a configuration has been used, in which the measuring clamp with the electrode are provided to the ankle area as a means for To be attached to bioelectrical impedance measurement an adhesive electrode can be used which directly close to the skin of the ankle area can be attached, or an alternative configuration can be used in which an electrode on a surface of the measuring unit may be arranged on which to arrange a foot of a subject is, so that one Sole of a foot can come into contact with it, reducing the measurement of bioelectric Impedance is allowed. Furthermore can, although in the above illustrated embodiment, the bioelectric Impedance between one and the other foot has been measured, one such impedance is measured by using only a single foot to determine whether he / she is in or out of condition, to develop thrombosis of deep-seated veins. In such a Case it becomes possible be able to make such a decision by, for example, Electrodes on the ankle area and the knee or thigh of a single leg, to measure the bioelectrical impedance between them. Furthermore is, although the state or status of the subject, that it is unlikely is to develop the thrombosis of low-lying lower leg veins, by levels such as the specific result in the above embodiments, is displayed, the display of the specific result is not limited to this but can be expressed by% or by expressions such as For example "Normal", "Be careful" or "Caution Required" represents become. Farther can from the point of view that the Standby time until execution the measurement of bioelectrical impedance both before the change of posture or change of position in the first embodiment as well as the time period of the reclining ones or lying position in the second embodiment as annoying for the subject be considered when such a configuration is used or which is an index concerning a body structure, like the body fat ratio or the body water content, which are calculated from the bioelectrical impedance value can, allowed, for the subject during the above time period and displayed, then the device be more comfortable, so that Subject would not be particularly sensitive to the wait. In addition, when the determination based on the difference between the values of the bioelectrical impedance, which are respectively measured before and after a change in position, such as  this is shown in the first embodiment, is combined with the determination based on the gradient of a bioelectrical impedance for a period of a certain body orientation, as shown in the second embodiment, to provide the device, the determination by using of two indices, then provide a more accurate determination as to whether or not the subject has the condition suitable for developing thrombosis of deep-seated veins. EFFECT OF INVENTION With the device for the determination of thromboses of deep-seated veins of the present invention, which has been configured to determine whether a subject has the state or status or not that is capable of thrombosis of low-lying veins in the area of the lower leg, the subject can develop his / her own Recognize condition in a simple manner. Furthermore can, as the device for the determination of low-lying veins according to a embodiment, which does not form part of the invention, the bioelectrical values Impedance before and after a change in position the posture measure and then determine from the deviation of whether one Subject having or not having the condition that is suitable for thrombosis develop low-lying veins, therefore this provision to a Time of a real circumstance or event of a blood transfer be given by the muscular pumping action of the subject which can directly influence the development of the thrombus, and hence the determination can be more accurate. Furthermore can, as the device for the determination of thrombosis low-lying Veins according to one embodiment, which does not form part of the present invention, the gradient a bioelectrical impedance can be determined by a deviation thereof represented per unit time becomes, after a subject body orientation, for example, from a reclining Position in a standing position, has changed, and then based on the value of the gradient can determine if the subject is the state or not, which is suitable for deep thrombosis To develop veins, therefore, the determination on a blood storage capacity in the area of the lower leg and therefore the determination of whether the subject has or does not have the condition that is suitable To develop thrombosis of low-lying veins of the lower leg, be more specific. Furthermore can, as the device for the determination of thrombosis low-lying Veins of the present invention have a reference choose can that for a determination based on the personal physical information for a Subject is suitable, therefore provided a more accurate determination whether or not the subject has the condition capable or not susceptible is to develop the thrombosis of low-lying veins of the lower leg. Yet Further, since the device for the determination of thrombosis deeper Veins of the present invention modify the reference value can order for the determination based on the degree of relevance of the subject to the factors which is considered to be used in thrombosis low-lying veins of the lower leg to be involved, therefore a more specific provision will be made available if that Subject having the condition or not suitable for the thrombosis low-lying veins of the lower leg to develop. Yet Further, since the device for the determination of thrombosis deeper Veins of the present invention concerning the hint or advice a method for preventing the development of thrombosis low-lying Provide veins of the lower leg, so that Subject knowledge of a prevention process can and will receive avoid the development of the disease or illness. It it is believed that if the device for the determination of thromboses is more deeply Veins of the present invention in a lobby of a Airport available is placed to order a condition that is expected Passenger or passenger for allows an airplane, to have a measurement before a departure, then the Passenger in advance may have a clue if he / she has the condition or not, which is suitable for deep thrombosis To develop veins of a lower leg, and to the passenger as well the information concerning the method for preventing the development the disease available can be put, which can help the development of the disease during and to prevent after the flight.

title: Method and apparatus for providing notification of network alarms using a plurality of distributed layers
abstract: A method is disclosed for providing notification of network alarms using a plurality of distributed layers. A message is received that indicates an event occurred at a primary entity. The event is bound to a managed object, which represents the primary entity, to create a bound event. An overall condition is determined for the primary entity, based at least in part on the bound event, to create one or more condition notifications. The impact of a particular condition notification on one or more entities, which are related to the primary entity, is analyzed to create one or more impact notifications. One or more first alarms, which indicate the one or more related entities are impacted by a particular impact notification, are created. One or more second alarms are created based on the one or more first alarms.

title: Regulatory elements of cold-inducible hutU gene from the Antarctic Psychrotrophic Bacterium Pseudomonas syringae
abstract: A DNA sequence from the upstream region of cold-inducible hutU gene of the Antarctic Psychrotrophic BacteriumPseudomonas syringae, comprising promoter elements and other regulatory sequences, with unique ‘CAAAA’ nucleotide sequence at −10 site of multiple transcription start sites and using said promoter to express genes of interest in the said bacterium at temperature as low as 4° C. and using the said bacterium with generation time ranging between two and half to three hours, as a system to produce heat labile proteins of pharmaceutical significance.

title: Digital content store system
abstract: The digital content store provides users with an opportunity to purchase authorized usage of digital content, such as single or multiple music tracks, video, movies, and/or video games. The users can also buy license to a desired track for a fixed number of times, e.g. preferably the users can listen on three different machines simultaneously. Users can also burn a play list of X number of times, for example ten. The burn limit preferably applies to the play list, not the song. Mixed media capability is provided that allows the purchase of digital content and/or physical media. The digital content store system comprises a unique digital rights management system and a back-end enabling system that controls these digital rights.

title: Unconstrained handwriting recognition
abstract: Methods and systems of the present invention may be used to recognize digital image data arranged in rows and columns. Exemplary embodiments may include a feature extractor for extracting feature information from data representing the rows and columns of the digital image data, a feature compressor for compressing the extracted feature information, and a neural network for classifying the digital image data from the compressed, extracted feature information.

title: Persistent snapshot management system
abstract: A persistent snapshot is taken and maintained in accordance with a novel method and system for extended periods of time using only a portion of a computer readable medium of which the snapshot is taken. Multiple snapshots can be taken in succession at periodic intervals and maintained practically indefinitely. The snapshots are maintained even after powering down and rebooting of the computer system. The state of the object of the snapshot for each snapshot preferably is accessible via a folder on volume of the snapshot. A restore of a file or folder may be accomplished by merely copy that file or folder from the snapshot folder to a current directory of the volume. Alternatively, the entire computer system may be restored to a previous snapshot state thereof. Snapshots that occurred after the state to which the computer is restored are not lost in the restore operation. Different rule sets and scenarios can be applied to each snapshot. Furthermore, each snapshot can be written to within the context of the snapshot and later restored to its pristine condition. Software for implementing the systems and methods of snapshots in accordance with the present invention may comprise firmware of a hard disk drive controller or a disk controller board or within the HDD casing itself. The present invention further comprises novel systems and methods in which the systems and methods of taking and maintaining snapshots are utilized in creating and managing temporal data stores, including temporal database management systems. The implications for data mining and exploration, data analysis, intelligence gathering, and artificial intelligence (just to name a few areas) are profound.

title: Detection methods and systems using sequenced technologies
abstract: Methods and systems for interconnecting sub-systems and for identifying combinations of multiple technologies.

title: System and method for visualization of continuous attribute values
abstract: Distribution displays for categories are provided which illuminate the distribution of continuous attributes over all cases in a category, and which provide a histogram of the population of the different states of categorical attributes. An array of such displays by attribute (in one dimension) and category (in another dimension) may be provided. Category diagram displays are also provided for visualizing the different categories, and their distributions, populations, and similarities. These are displayed through different shading of nodes and edges representing categories and the relationship between two categories, and through proximity of nodes.

title: Identifying solutions to computer problems in main system by service system
abstract: A computer system landscape has a main system to execute an application and a remote service system to evaluate problems in the main system. The main system has database, application server and a front-end server. The service system has a service module to collect problem related data from the main system, an acquisition module to acquire knowledge representations, a knowledge module to store the knowledge representations, an inference module for processing problem related data with the knowledge representations to identify solutions, the inference module forwards the solutions through the service module to the main system. Main system and service system communicate through a network. Main and service systems have client/server configuration.

title: Method and system for wireless intrusion detection
abstract: A wireless intrusion detection system (WIDS) is disclosed for monitoring both authorized and unauthorized access to a wireless portion of a network. The WIDS consists of a collector and one or more nodes that communicate via an out of band means that is separate from the network. Unauthorized access points and unauthorized clients in the network can be detected. The WIDS can be used to monitor, for example, a network implemented using the 802.11 protocol. In addition, the WIDS can be used by one company to provide a service that monitors the wireless network of another company.

title: Method and apparatus for reducing a nitrogen oxide, and control thereof
abstract: Disclosed herein is a method and apparatus for reducing a nitrogen oxide, and the control thereof.

title: Method and apparatus for processing and routing transactions
abstract: Option orders are processed by receiving an option order, the option order including information identifying a customer, and information identifying a desired option. One of a plurality of option exchanges is selected to complete the option order, the selecting based on information identifying the customer and the desired option. In some embodiments, a routing rule is selected based on the information identifying a customer.

title: Topology aware route control
abstract: The present invention uses proxy points for measuring different routes to a destination address space. Multiple paths to the desired destination address space are identified. Each path begins at a source and terminates at the destination address space. Proxy points are identified for each path and are associated with a point between the source and the destination address space. Measurements of the path performance from each source to the appropriate proxy point are compared to determine an optimum route.

title: Nucleic acid and corresponding protein entitled 213P1F11 useful in treatment and detection of cancer
abstract: A novel gene (designated 213P1F11) and its encoded protein, and variants thereof, are described wherein 213P1F11 exhibits tissue specific expression in normal adult tissue, and is aberrantly expressed in the cancers listed in Table I. Consequently, 213P1F11 provides a diagnostic, prognostic, prophylactic and/or therapeutic target for cancer. The 213P1F11 gene or fragment thereof, or its encoded protein, or variants thereof, or a fragment thereof, can be used to elicit a humoral or cellular immune response; antibodies or T cells reactive with 213P1F11 can be used in active or passive immunization.

title: Packet data serving node (PDSN) load optimization
abstract: A method and node for supporting PDSN load optimization in a CDMA2000 network. The Packet Core Network Manager calculates network statistics and uses the resulting numbers to set the PPP inactivity timer depending on the load on the PDSN. In a preferred embodiment, the calculation gives the mean value of the durations of the PPP sessions (KPI1), and the corresponding standard deviation (KPI2). The PPP inactivity timer is then set to M*(KPI1+KPI2) during low load, to M*KPI1during normal load, and to M*(KPI1−KPI2) during heavy load, where 0<M<=1, preferably depending on the distribution of the subscriber inter-arrival time.

title: Color data accuracy calculating method, color data accuracy calculating apparatus, color processing method, color processing apparatus, color data accuracy calculating program, color processing program, and storage medium
abstract: A target color signal pair extraction section extracts from color signal pairs each including an input color signal and a counterpart output color signal, a target color signal pair including a target input color signal and a counterpart target output color signal. An output vicinity color signal extraction section extracts from the color signal pairs, output vicinity color signals corresponding to input vicinity color signals, which are located in the vicinity of the target input color signal. A color signal pair accuracy calculation section calculates a color signal pair accuracy of the target color signal pair on the basis of a relation between the target output color signal and the plurality of output vicinity color signals.

title: Determination of mobile station location
abstract: A system, method and processing unit for mobile station location determination. Mobile Assisted Handoff (MAHO) measurements are sent to the processing unit that also retrieves the corresponding transmitted signal strengths and electromagnetic field distribution functions for the relevant base stations. The location of the mobile station is then determined by minimising the following formula:F⁡(γ,x,y)=∑j=1m⁢M⁡(PRj-γ·PTj·Gj⁡(x,y))where m is the number of relevant base stations, M is an optimisation metric (such as (εj)2or |εj|)PRjis received signal strength, PTjtransmitted signal strength, γ attenuation (e.g. in the mobile station), and Gj(x,y) the electromagnetic field distribution function.

title: Object recognition system
abstract: A method recognizes an object in an image. Gallery images include identified objects, and a probe image includes an unidentified object. The probe image is paired with each gallery image to generate pairs of images. First filters are applied to the probe image of each pair to obtain a first feature value for each application of each filter. Second filters are applied to the each gallery image of each pair to obtain a second feature value for each application of each filter. The feature values are summed for each application of each filter, and for each application, a score is set to an acceptance weight if the sum is greater than a predetermined threshold, and otherwise setting the score to a rejection weight. The scores are summed for all of the application, and the probe image is identified with any gallery image when the score is greater than zero.

title: System for and method of positioning cells and determining cellular activity thereof
abstract: A device for positioning at least one cell in at least one addressable position, the device comprising a substrate formed with at least one addressable pore and at least one channel embedded in the substrate and being in fluid communication with the at least one pore. The at least one pore and the at least one channel are designed and constructed such that an under-pressure formed in the at least one channel results in vacuum adherence of the at least one cell onto the at least one pore, such that a single cell is vacuum adhered onto a single pore. In one embodiment, the substrate is a non-conductive substrate and is further formed with one or more electrode structures, where each of the electrode structures is positioned in one of the pores. In an additional embodiment the device is designed locatable onto an organ, such as a brain.

title: Computer-based intelligence method and apparatus for assessing selected subject-area problems and situations
abstract: A computer-based method and apparatus for assessing problems and situations in a defined knowledge domain, employing both (a) an inferential database of elemental data components, as domain-wide as possible, which are relevant to the domain, and (b) periodic statistical reviews of reported assessment results in relation to that database to establish the certainty levels of such results. The invention employs nonlinear assessment techniques likenable to human reasoning, and thereby, as well as in other ways, conducts assessment tasks in a manner that differentiates it from conventional, machine-based, linear problem resolution.

title: Method and apparatus for controlling exhausted gas emissions during cold-start of an internal combustion engine
abstract: An in-cylinder ion sensor provides a signal representative of the air/fuel ratio of the charge mixture as an engine starts. The signal representative of the air/fuel ratio is used as a feedback signal for an electronic control unit to perform cold-start closed-loop control during an initial operating period from a cold-start before an on-board oxygen sensor is able to warm up. After reaching a functional operating temperature, the oxygen sensor provides a signal that is used as an adaptive calibration tool which allows the electronic control unit to calibrate the ion sensor signal and use that signal for controlling the air/fuel ratio during cold start operation.

title: Software for generating a computer application code and software description language
abstract: The software generates the computer code of at least one part of a computer application, from a description of this part of the computer application by distributing this part among several code generators according to modifiable distribution rules. Each code generator translates the part of the description that it is provided with, in order to provide at least one part of the computer code in a respective language. The invention also relates to a software description language, notably of the type of an object-oriented language for computer application modeling. The invention also relates to a software enabling to graphically or textually build a computer application model, notably a computer application human-machine interface model, and to provide a description of the model in a software description language according to the invention.

title: Method and apparatus for dynamic checking and reporting system health
abstract: The present invention provides a method and apparatus for remotely analyzing and affirmatively notifying appropriate personnel of problems and events associated with an oil recovery system—comprising hundreds of oil rigs over a vast geographic area. The results of selected Health Checks, which are run on each oilrig, are reported to a central server. The central server populates a data base for the oil recovery system, displays a red/yellow/green color coded electronic notification and status for an entire oil recovery system and affirmatively alerts appropriate personnel of actions required to address events associated with an oilrig in an oil recovery system. The diagnostics run at each oilrig are configurable at the individual rig. The present invention provides a dynamic oilrig status reporting protocol that enables population and display of a tree node structure representing an entire oil recovery system status on a single screen at a top level. Detailed information is available by drilling down in to other screens, enabling rapid visual evaluation of a system Health Check.

title: Automated processing of appropriateness determination of content for search listings in wide area network searches
abstract: A method and system for improving the efficiency of a database processing system for evaluating candidate data items representing search listings that are submitted for inclusion into a search engine database. Candidate search listings are automatically assessed for quality, style, and relevance to evaluate risk of unfavorable reception by a user and of potential exposure volume. Search listings which are higher-risk or higher-volume are routed through manual editorial review while lower-risk, lower-volume search listings are routed for immediate inclusion in the search database without manual editorial evaluation. Accordingly, human editorial efforts can be devoted to manual review of high-risk or high-volume search listings while efficiency is simultaneously improved in the processing system as a whole.

title: Method of keying a borehole in a seismic block
abstract: The aim of the present invention is the determination of the best possible correlation (keying) for electric recordings obtained in a borehole with seismic recordings obtained in a volume of subsoil (the seismic block) containing the bore. This is accomplished by defining in a neighborhood of the trajectory of the bore a set of layered networks, the entries of which are the seismic signals and the exits of which are electric signals. Accordingly, a quality measure is awarded with regard to the convergence. The best convergence quality then permits the determination of the best place in the neighborhood which produces the best keying.

title: Application-specific object-based segmentation and recognition system
abstract: A video detection and monitoring method and apparatus utilizes an application-specific object based segmentation and recognition system for locating and tracking an object of interest within a number of sequential frames of data collected by a video camera or similar device. One embodiment includes a background modeling and object segmentation module to isolate from a current frame at least one segment of the current frame containing a possible object of interest, and a classification module adapted to determine whether or not any segment of the output from the background modeling apparatus includes an object of interest and to characterize any such segment as an object segment. An object segment tracking apparatus is adapted to track the location within a current frame of any object segment and to determine a projected location of the object segment in a subsequent frame.

title: CLASSIFYING SEA FLOORNESS WITH SOM AND LVQ
abstract: TECHNICAL FIELD The The present invention relates to a system for classifying the roughness of the seabed using a hybrid layout an artificial, neural network (ANN) using unprocessed, multi-beam backscatter data. More specifically, the present invention relates to a system for online classification the roughness of a seabed using unprocessed multi-beam angle backscatter data using an unmonitored Learning, such as a preprocessor, and supervised learning, such as the inference block, for one improved classification, resulting in a highly efficient, neural hybrid network layout leads, to classify an unclassified record. BACKGROUND before known neural classifiers for classifying the seafloor [Z. Michalopoulou, D. Alexandrou, and C. de Moustier, "Application of Neural and Statistical Classifiers to the problem of Seaflor Characterization " IEEE Journal of Oceanic Engineering, Vol. 20, pp. 190-197 (1994)] describes a self-organizing list (SOM) network that is applied to a multi-beam backscatter dataset. The disadvantage This system is the one that can use only processed data. Another disadvantage is its unsuitability for an online application. One alternative system [B. Chakraborty, R. Kaustubha, A. Hedge, A. Pereira, "Acoustic Seafloor Sediment Classification Using Self-Organizing Feature Maps, IEEE Transactions Geoscience and Remote Sensing, Vol. 12, pages 2722-2725 (2001)] a SOM network where a single-beam record for classification of the seabed, and this system is better suited for online use. However, that's a limitation This system assumes that there is a preprocessing of the timeline record a classification requires. In US patent application no. 09 / 814,104, the applicants have a system described in the classification of the seabed. This system, which is described in this application, estimates the acoustic backscatter of the Seabed with the root-mean-square (r.m.s) Echo voltage of the signal duration for every ray. For This system becomes multi-beam angle backscatter data from the various Using areas of the seabed around the Indian Ocean around a multiple beam acoustic system (hydrosweep) installed Board of Ocean Research Vessel Sagar Kanya, received. A disadvantage of the system indicated above is that it requires a large time overhead, around the rough data for an area-related enhancement of seabed tilt correction and correct insonification depth normalization. One yet another system [B. Chakraborty, H.W. Schenke, V. Kodagali, and R. Hagen, "Seabottom Characterization Using Multi-beam Echo-Sounder: An Application of the Composite Roughness Theory ", IEEE Transactions Geoscience and Remote Sensing, Vol. 38, p 2419-2422 (2000)] describes a system for a classification of the seabed, which has been observed that the parameters for the roughness of the seabed (power-law parameters) the ideal Parameters for the classification are. The disadvantage of this system is that the classification of the seabed only after performing a physical model representation of the composite roughness parameters accomplished can be. TASKS OF INVENTION The The main object of the present invention is to provide a novel system for the Classification of the seafloor using a hybrid layout an artificial, neural network (ANN) using the to create unprocessed multi-beam backscatter data. A Another object of the present invention is to provide a system for on-line (i.e., real-time) classification of the seabed using backscatter data after one Training of the self-organized, self-organized (self-organized mapping - SOM) Network and Learning Vector Quantization (learning vector quantization - LVQ) network to accomplish. A Still another object of the present invention is a system to create a hybrid network using one not supervised SOM as the first block for a rough classification of the backscatter data of the seabed and a supervised LVQ for a much improved functionality in this classification starts. NOVELTY AND INVENTIVE ACTIVITIES The Novelty and the inventive activity of present invention are in an ingenious system for classification of the seabed using a hybrid layout of an artificial, neural Network (ANN) using unprocessed multi-beam backscatter data, thereby the requirement for the conventional, labor-intensive and time-consuming Bypass preprocessing task that was otherwise required would. The System of the present invention allows on-line (i.e., real-time) classification of the seabed using backscatter data after one Training of the self-organized, self-organized (self-organized mapping - SOM) Network and Learning Vector Quantization (learning vector quantization - LVQ) network. Furthermore, the system of the present invention has the unique Ability of combined use of unmonitored SOM, followed by a supervised LVQ, to a greatly improved functioning in the classification reach, which was previously nonexistent. The system of the present Invention has the additional Ability, to use a combination of two variations of the LVQ layout, so as to work together to get the best results in the classification of the seabed. DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THE PREFERRED EMBODIMENTS 1represents the schematic of a single-beam echosounder, in which an acoustic transducer [1] mounted below a research vessel [2], sends acoustic impulses to the seafloor in a direction perpendicular to the sea level, and receives the echo scattered back from the seafloor. The ship moves along a given pre-planned path, wherein a series of successive echoes scattered back from successive segments on the seabed are received by in-board receiver hardware and recorded in its data storage module as a time-series record , A disadvantage of this single-beam echosounder is that the coverage area of the seabed achievable in this manner is limited to the footprint of a single acoustic beam impinging on the seabed. 2provides the schematic of a multi-beam echosounder [3], which is used for simultaneous mapping of the seabed over large areas. In this geometry, the transducers are spaced in such a manner as to provide overlapping seabed coverage. The fan-beam type acoustic system consists of a linear array of transducers located below the hull [4] are mounted. This fan-beam type echosounder system basically consists of two main subsystems, namely an acoustic subsystem [5] and a data processing subsystem [6]. The acoustic subsystem has a linear array of transducers that are under a particular, suitable, angular  Separation are installed, cable junction boxes, a field of transceiver systems for the respective converter field and usually a rattle tamping lift sensor for input to the online processing system. The data processing control system employs a marine computer, data storage devices, and so forth. The multi-beam echo sounder is a device that provides higher resolution mapping of the marine bed. This system is capable of achieving greater coverage, as well as producing a card with high precision. The use of the multi-beam echosounding system results in the production of seabed profiles correlated to a single, central lane and allows more reliable correlation of intersecting lanes. 312 shows a schematic representation of the beam configuration of the multi-beam echosounder used as part of the novel system of the present invention for a classification of the seabed using a Hybrid Artificial Neural Network (ANN) layout using unprocessed multi-beam backscatter Data consisting primarily of two identical fields [7] and [8th] acoustic transducer, mounted at right angles to each other, consists. Each field is a combination of several subfields [7.1], ... [7.n] and [8.1], ... [8.n.], each one consisting of a plurality of elements. These elements form a set of channels [9.1], [9.2], ... [9.n.], where each channel consists of a group of elements in series. Similarly, for another counterpart converter field, the receive channels [10.1], [10.2], ... [10.n]. Since both fields are identical, they can be used for either sending or receiving. In the receive mode, signals from different channels are pre-amplified, corrected for attenuation, and then a beamform is performed using appropriate delays. Overall, a fixed number of preformed steels (pfb) are formed within a strip of 90 °. The rays are evenly spaced (~ 1.5 °), with average beam widths ranging from 1.5 ° to 2.3 ° for deep sea surveys. The half power beam width becomes about twice as fast when operating the system in a shallow water mode. The beamformed outputs are tapped at the bottom echo module to estimate the depth corresponding to the beams from different directions. To achieve uniform insonification across a 90 ° stripe, the system is designed to operate in a swath mode. 412 shows a schematic block diagram of the signal processing hardware used for steel forming the backscattered signal sequence, which consists primarily of a preamplifier.11], a time-varying gain adjustment circuit [12], a beam former [13], a digital-to-analog converter [14], a filter [15], an analog-to-digital (A / D) converter [16], a ground tracking gate [bottom guide opening] [17], an ad [18] consists. The digital data used for seabed classification is taken from the output channel of the A / D converter [16] derived. This signal becomes an rms estimation module [19] whose outputs are used as the input vectors for further processing. 5FIG. 12 illustrates the schematic block diagram of the hybrid ANN layout used in the system of the present invention. This layout consists of a self-organizing map SOM network [20], a learning vector quantization variant 1 (LVQ1) [21] and the memory / display module [22]. The input to the SOM network [20] is determined by the output of the rms estimation module [19] derived. In the system of the present invention, the SOM network receives [20] the unprocessed multi-beam backscatter rms data (the pattern of which is the enveloping rms signal amplitude versus the beam number in the cross-track direction) obtained from the different preformed beams and classifies the seabed data into different roughnesses types. The different roughness types are differentiated based on the ship's lane-angle multi-beam signal backscatter shape parameter. Each cluster thus formed represents a unique pattern of the input data. Accordingly, the number of clusters formed is equal to the number of differing patterns of the received seabed record. These clusters are formed with the SOM network's own unmonitored learning feature without any prior knowledge of the number of different types of input patterns. The clusters of the dataset generated by the SOM [20] are added to the LVQ1 [21] entered. The non-perfect classification given to the SOM network [20] due to the nature of the unattended learning, without any background knowledge (of the input data types), is partly due to the LVQ1 network [21] eliminated. This improvement in the classification of the seafloor results from the supervised learning, based on the feedback contributed to the LVQ1 network [21] is delivered by the interpreter in the form of a person, judged by the ground truth record. The enhancement is based on the "reward punishment" criterion, where a correctly representing weighting vector is created to better match the input, while a misrepresentation weighting vector is away from the input  is moved so that it will avoid misclassification in future comparisons. The LVQ1 [21] works more efficiently at the central area of the weighting distribution of each cluster formed in the SOM [20], as the end of the distribution due to the inability of the LVQ1 [21] to distinguish the overlapping ends of adjacent clusters. The outputs of the LVQ1 [21] are subsequently added to the storage and display module [22], where an interpreter in the form of a person may make use of the results indicated to make further judgments about the quality of a classification. 6FIG. 12 illustrates the schematic block diagram of an alternative hybrid ANN layout used in the system of the present invention along with the layout described in FIG5is shown is used. This layout is similar to the one in5the only difference being that while the LVQ1 [21] misclassification to a greater extent at the central area of the weighting distribution of each cluster formed in the SOM [20], as avoids at the rear of the distribution, the LVQ2 network focuses on minimizing the misclassification (which arises in SOM) as a consequence of the ability to distinguish the overlapping ends of the weighting distribution of adjacent clusters. The LVQ2 [23] employs a technique for redistributing the weights of the overlapping regions of the adjacent clusters to the respective parent clusters. The outputs of the LVQ2 [23] are subsequently added to the memory and display module [22], where the results are displayed and stored to allow an interpreter in the form of a person to make further judgments about the quality of the classification. 7FIG. 12 depicts the schematic block diagram of an improved hybrid ANN layout used in the system of the present invention along with the layout incorporated in FIGS5and6is shown used. This layout has the advantage of performing a seabed classification based on the different capabilities of LVQ1 [21] and LVQ2 [23] to thereby obtain the best possible classification considering the central as well as the rear of the weighting distributions in the process of classification. 8threpresents the clustering of the vectors of unprocessed data resulting in the SOM network specified above [20] and the features of supervised learning by LVQ1 [21] and LVQ2 [23], both independently and combined with each other. In this illustration, two weighting vectors arranged on each side of the boundary (shown as a thick vertical line) have been given to lie within the overlapping area of adjacent clusters. In the presentation of the8thput the segments [24.1], [24.2] and [24.3] three consecutive weight distribution patterns [24represented by the unmonitored SOM [20], where the symbols (•), (|), and (/) indicate three different classes of roughness parameters of the seabed. As a representative example, the weight distribution pattern [25] at the output of the LVQ1 [21] of the monitored architecture significantly removes the central, misclassified areas (•) of [24.1] and [24.2], and their further development into the parent cluster, represented by the segment [24.3], thereby improving the redistribution in segments [25.1], [25.2] and [25.3] of the full weight distribution pattern [25] to achieve. The weight distribution pattern [26]represents the effectiveness of LVQ2 [23] of the monitored layout, with the segments [26.1], [26.2] and [26.3] removing the vector (/) of the misclassified data from the back of [24.1] and [24.3] of the SOM output [24] and its further development to its parent segment [24.2], as shown in [26] while the classification error in the central areas of the weight distribution pattern in [26.1], indicated by (•), is ignored. The weight distribution pattern [27] represents the effectiveness of a classification with the combined use of LVQ1 [21] and LVQ2 [23], with the misclassifications occurring both in the central and in the back of [24are corrected to provide a fully corrected weight distribution pattern [27] to obtain. 9provides a table of roughness parameters and classification results (in percentages) for three areas of a seabed, tested using LVQ1, LVQ2, and a combination of both the above-monitored layouts, using SOM as the preprocessor in each case, represents. Generally, in the hydrosweep multi-beam echosounding system, the two outboard port and starboard side outboard beam blanks are faulty and neglected. As a result, the original input beam vector of 59 becomes a field of 55 beam values from an angle of -45 ° to + 45 °. In this embodiment, each of the 55 beam values for 5 input vectors is averaged at a time for smoothing the input vector. By reducing variations in the input patterns from the same seabed area, one can obtain a slightly improved classification operation, albeit at the cost of computation time  th. The preprocessor block uses unmonitored learning to form a self-organized mapping of 100 input vectors from different seabeds. The input data vectors are converted from the decibel scale to their natural values. Each vector is then normalized to adjust the range of weights. The data is still unprocessed in the sense that no preprocessing algorithm (PROBASI) has been applied to it. From each seabed area, a respective backscatter record is selected for training the SOM network. In this architecture, neighboring entities, referred to as neurons, compete with each other through the mutual, lateral interaction of their weights. The weights in the neighborhood of the nearest matching neuron to the input vector given are updated from an initial random distribution so as to bring them closer to that input vector. This leads to the formation of local neighborhoods, indicating a particular class. The learning rate is an exponential decreasing function 0.5 / (t0.2), where t is the number of iterations, thus causing the rate of weighting to be updated to be high initially, and then gradually for finer tuning in subsequent iterations until finally only one neuron emerges in response to an input being delivered. At the end of the execution of the SOM algorithm, the input space aligns into coarse clusters, each representing a unique input pattern, without any a priori information. Future input vectors provided in the test phase are assigned to a cluster in the output space that best fits the input vector. The power-law parameters (gamma and beta) for the different seabed areas, obtained through physical modeling, are used to correlate the results obtained. The trained weighting matrix, after the SOM network has been set up, as the inputs for a supervised, learning network, namely LVQ, used. This is a training and testing simultaneously for a few iterations performed, until the network weights that belong to each cluster really for this Cluster representative are. The learning rate is still exponential, but with a lot smaller initial value, to a fine tuning of neuron weights to enable. In LVQ1, under the control of the user, for 3-4 input vectors from each class, the incorrectly classified weighting vector moved away from the entrance. If the classification is correct, the weighting vector is amplified toward the input and a final misclassification will result in further testing avoided. LVQ2 goes a step further to the overlapping ones Weighting biases in areas of crossover from neighboring ones Clusters by applying the window function to their boundary for a correction on 1-2 Overcome neurons. The window will be in half subdivided and corrections are made only if that highlighted neuron falls on the wrong side of the midplane, namely by moving the vector away from the entrance and by simultaneously Bring the neuron closer to the correct half of the window. An expression is taken from the probability density function (pdf) of the highlighted neuron versus the frequency of the excitation performed. In particular, three seabed areas A, B and C are used for the comparative study here. The results of the classification are tabulated in9specified for SOM, LVQ1, and LVQ2 for unprocessed backscatter data. Comparing the tabulated Power Law parameters (gamma and beta), which act as an indicator of seabed interface roughness, with self-organized clusters after training by SOM, it has been found that the ranges A and C are of the same type of seabed. Between the two, the classification results indicated increased functionality with LVQ for region C, which is rougher, as indicated by its higher Chrαvalue (rms roughness between two points separated by a distance of 100 m). The most significant contribution of this invention is the ability of the network to provide excellent response to unprocessed data, thereby eliminating the need for lengthy preprocessing of the multi-beam backscatter data for sea floor roughness theory, thereby providing an on-line display of the ocean floor roughness Roughness, just using rough data to deliver. BENEFITS OF THE PRESENT INVENTION

title: Odor measuring apparatus
abstract: The present invention proposes an odor measuring apparatus capable of determining the similarity of the odor of an unknown sample with high objectivity and performing measurements with sensitivity similar to that of the human nose. According to a mode of the invention, an m-dimensional space is created from detection signals of m pieces of odor sensors, and a standard odor vector S1representing the result of measurement of a standard odor and another vector Sx representing the result of measurement of an unknown sample are drawn in the space. Then, from the angle θ between the two vectors, a degree of similarity is determined within the range from 0 to 100%, where the degree of similarity is corrected taking account of the difference in sensitivity between the odor sensor and the human nose. The degree of similarity of the unknown odor is calculated for each of plural standard odors measured beforehand, and which standard odor is the closest to the odor of the unknown sample is objectively shown by numeral values.

title: Detecting and modeling temporal computer activity patterns
abstract: A method is described with which to detect and model a person's temporal activity patterns from a record of the persons computer activity or online presence. The method is both predictive and descriptive of temporal features and is constructed with a minimal amount of beforehand knowledge. Activity related data is accumulated from a mechanism that is involved in the activity of a person. Significant inactivity features are identified within the activity data. These inactivity features are characterized so as to project the temporal activity of the person. Real-time activity of the person is then detected and inactivity periods are checked for likelihood of belonging to a previously characterized significant feature. The resulting information is formatted and made available to individuals having a need for the information.

title: Percutaneous absorption type plaster
abstract: A transdermal patch comprising a backing2and an adhesive layer3laminated on the backing2, wherein the adhesive layer3comprises a rosin-based resin and petroleum resin as a tackifier, the total compounding amount of the rosin-based resin and the petroleum resin is in a range of 15% by mass to 50% by mass, and compounding amount of the petroleum resin is ⅓ times by mass to 4 times by mass as that of the rosin-based resin.

title: MAXIMUM ADDRESSING ON THE MEASUREMENT OF SURFACE EXTENSION IN A TIRE PANEL WALL
abstract: A method of determining the grip coefficient mu in the contact area of a tire on a road includes the steps of selecting a plurality of fixed points in space (that is to say ones that are fixed in the reference frame associated with the vehicle) which points lie at different azimuths along the circumference in at least one sidewall of the tire, obtaining a corresponding number of measurements of circumferential distance variation (extension or contraction) at these fixed points when the tire is rolling on the road, and the measurement signals are processed so as to extract the grip coefficient mu.

title: Glucose transport mutants for production of biomaterial
abstract: A method is disclosed for restoring a Glu+phenotype to a PTS−/Glu−bacterial cell which was originally capable of utilizing a phosphotransferase transport system (PTS) for carbohydrate transport. Bacterial cells comprising the Glu+phenotype have modified endogenous chromosomal regulatory regions which are operably linked to polynucleotides encoding galactose permeases and glucokinases.

title: System and methods for rapid and automated screening of cells
abstract: A system for performing automated cell screening in drug discovery, includes an automated microscope, a fast autofocus device, and a digital imaging system. Processes are implemented in software through which relevant cellular material is segmented and quantified with minimal user interaction. Improvements in the following areas: known methods for image processing are implemented in such a way that automated segmentation is achieved; sets of known measurements (pixel counting, etc.) are implemented as methods which demonstrate aspects of biology in a reliable fashion; components for automated positioning, focusing, imaging and processing of a multiplicity of samples are integrated as systems within which the segmentation and measurement methods may be mounted; and components and methods are adapted into systems which yield more highly automated and more rapid cell screening.

title: Electro-optical device for the acquisition and processing of images
abstract: Electro-optical device for the acquisition and processing of images, provided with an image acquisition unit and a calculator unit. The calculator unit comprises at least a neural-type processor. The image acquisition unit and the calculator unit are made using CMOS technology, and are integrated on the same silicon support element to implement the device in a single microchip.

title: Method for generating learning and/or sample probes
abstract: In the present invention information is first defined as a complete description of the meaning of the content, in addition to the required layout of the characters, words, delivery addresses or images of the entire delivery surface, which contains the delivery addresses, as sample elements. The images of the sample elements belonging to the defined reference information are then generated with the aid of type libraries for the defined character fonts and languages and said images are then stored, after having been assigned to the reference information, in the form of a pixel representation for the sample. The images of the sample elements that have been generated in the previous step are subsequently varied by means of known image processing algorithms to create at least one statistical variation corresponding to the previously collected, grouped deliveries, according to the defined sample scope.

title: System and method for creating a representation of an assembly
abstract: Systems or methods for creating a finite element model from a list of component identifiers. For example, a CAD drawing could be automatically and dynamically created from a bill of material. Manufacturing instructions can be included into the model creation process. The bill of material need not specify the assembly being generated.

title: Image processing for vehicular applications applying edge detection technique
abstract: Arrangement and method for obtaining information about objects in an environment in or around a vehicle includes one or more optical imagers for obtaining images of the environment and a processor coupled to the imager(s) for obtaining information about an object in one or more images obtained by the imager(s). The processor is arranged to process the obtained images to determine edges of objects in the images and input data about the edges into a trained pattern recognition algorithm which has been trained to provide information about the object as output. The pattern recognition algorithm may include a neural network or variation thereof. The information about the object may be used to control a vehicular component such as an airbag or light filter.

title: Blind signal separation
abstract: A method of blind signal separation of convolutively mixed signals comprises firstly processing signals to produce second order independence. In a second step, and together with ranges of signal delay and rotation parameters, the resulting processed signals are used to determine delay and rotation parameters. These parameters implement at least one elementary paraunitary matrix and transform the processed signals into output signals with improvement in independence to at least a predominant part of a maximum extent obtainable over the parameter ranges. The output signals then become the next processed signals and the second step is iterated until independence ceases to be improved significantly. The latest output signals are then unmixed signals.

title: Method and apparatus for analyzing spatial and temporal processes of interaction
abstract: Devices and techniques for estimating the concentration of one or more agents in a fluid environment employ a plurality of measurements of a sensor attribute that changes in response to an agent. Measurements taken before the agent/reagent combination reaches a steady-state may be used. The plurality of measurements are processed using a nonlinear, parametric model of the interaction between the sensor and the agent to determine the concentration of the agent. The model takes into account the finite capacity of a sensor reagent. The model characterizes the interaction of individual agent/reagent combinations with a set of parameters. These parameters require minimal testing to calculate. The invention enables the response of a sensor to an agent over the entire range of agent concentration levels to be efficiently and accurately characterized. The invention also enables the prediction of collective responses given parameters characterizing a plurality of agent/reagent combinations.

title: Summarization of sumo video content
abstract: Summarization of video content, such as a video that includes sumo, by a method that provides a description of the video, identifies a plurality of segments of the video based upon the provided description, and generates another video based upon the identified segments, having less frames than the original video.

title: Systems and methods for biopolymer engineering
abstract: Methods, computer systems, and computer program products for biopolymer engineering. A variant set for a biopolymer of interest is constructed by identifying, using a plurality of rules, a plurality of positions in the biopolymer of interest and, for each respective position in the plurality of positions, substitutions for the respective position. The plurality of positions and the substitutions for each respective position in the plurality of positions collectively define a biopolymer sequence space. A variant set comprising a plurality of variants of the biopolymer of interest is selected. A property of all or a portion of the variants in the variant set is measured. A sequence-activity relationship is modeled between (i) one or more substitutions at one or more positions of the biopolymer of interest represented by the variant set and (ii) the property measured for all or the portion of the variants in the variant set. The variant set is redefined to comprise variants that include substitutions in the plurality of positions that are selected based on a function of the sequence-activity relationship.

title: Regulating the growth of complexity in developmental systems
abstract: Developmental systems (1/11) are provided with an autotelic mechanism for driving their development. An autotelic component (1) in the system uses a mapping mechanism (2) to produce an output based on a set of inputs. The mapping mechanism (2) implements a mapping that is dependent upon a state associated therewith. The content of the state is changed by a learning/repair module (3) based on interactions between the system and the environment, and so reflects knowledge gained by this component as a result of its experience. The autotelic component (1) monitors its own performance with reference to the level of a set of one or more challenge parameters whose levels quantify the complexity of different parameters relating to the autotelic component (1). The state associated with the mapping mechanism2is altered depending upon the component's performance as evaluated during the monitoring. A controller (5) controls the levels of the challenge parameters.

title: Centralized server obtaining security intelligence knowledge by analyzing VoIP bit-stream
abstract: Systems and methods provide security intelligence knowledge of network communications. Particularly, VoIP packetized data being communicated over the network, together with other types of data communications over the network, is monitored and detected. From the VoIP packetized data, select portions or streams of the VoIP packetized data are identified. The select packetized data is then matched to a fingerprint or other indicia that indicates that the data is suspect for security intelligence knowledge purposes. The matched data is translated for purposes of taking security precautions based on the content of the security intelligence knowledge so gleaned.

title: Low memory decision tree
abstract: Management of a low memory treelike data structure is shown. The method according to the invention comprises steps for creating a decision tree including a parent node and at least one leaf node, and steps for searching data from said nodes. The nodes of the decision tree are stored sequentially in such a manner that nodes follow the parent node in storage order, wherein the nodes refining the context of the searchable data can be reached without a link from their parent node. The method can preferably be utilized in speech-recognition systems, in text-to-phoneme mapping.

title: Esophageal waveform analysis for detection and quantification of reflux episodes
abstract: A system and method for automatically analyzing impedance and pH data from an esophageal probe includes a data collection system that collects and stores the output from the sensors for a certain period of time to locate reflux episodes in the waveforms. The data analysis system uses wavelet analysis to assist in locating bolus entry and exit points in the waveforms and to smooth waveforms for additional analysis. It also distinguishes between candidate acid reflux episodes and candidate non-acid reflux episodes for determining actual acid reflux episodes and non-acid reflux episodes, and it distinguishes between, and provides different signal processing for, signals from patients that have healthy esophageal tissue and those that have diseased esophageal tissue.

title: Binary delta-sigma modulator
abstract: A modulator, including an integrator (118), a bistable device (110), an adder (102) and a feedback loop (116) is provided. A method for converting a continuous time signal to a binary signal is also provided.

title: Compound word breaker and spell checker
abstract: A method of determining the component words of a compound word is disclosed. The method identifies the component words, by comparing the word with a list of words found in a lexicon. If the word is not found in the lexicon the method proceeds to analyze the word on a character-by-character basis. After each character the method identifies any potential matches to the selected characters in the lexicon. If a match is found, it is added to a hypothesis trace in a lattice. Next, the method checks to see whether the remaining characters form a valid entry in the lexicon, and whether the entry is allowed to be a final segment.

title: Bovine adeno-associated viral (BAAV) vector and uses thereof
abstract: The present invention provides a bovine adeno-associated virus (BAAV) virus and vectors and particles derived therefrom. In addition, the present invention provides methods of delivering a nucleic acid to a cell using the BAAV vectors and particles.

title: Microfabricated compositions and processes for engineering tissues containing multiple cell types
abstract: The present invention relates to a three-dimensional system, and compositions obtained therefrom, wherein individual layers of the system comprise channels divided longitudinally into two compartments by a centrally positioned membrane, and wherein each compartment can comprise a different cell type.

title: Current-mode synapse multiplier circuit
abstract: A current-mode synapse multiplier circuit multiplies each of a plurality of pulse signals with each of a corresponding plurality of weight signals. The synapse multiplier includes a plurality of first switches each coupled to a corresponding pulse signal and the corresponding weight signal. An integral circuit is coupled to the first switches to receive the weight signals that pass through the first switches and integrates the sum of the weight signals that pass through the first switches over a period of time. A voltage-to-current (V-I) converter is coupled to the integral circuit to convert the integral of the sum of the weight signals that pass through the first switches into a current signal, wherein the current signal represents the sum of the multiplication products of each pulse signal and the corresponding weight signal. An external reset signal is coupled to the synapse multiplier through a second switch to reset the synapse multiplier.

title: Portable combustible gas detector
abstract: A portable detector of combustible or explosive gases incorporates a polymeric-type sensor or sensor array coupled to a programmed processor which carries out an evaluation of one or more signals from the sensor or array to evaluate the presence of combustible or explosive vapors. Non-polymeric sensors such as temperature sensors, humidity sensors and/or pressure sensors can also be incorporated and their outputs evaluated to compensate the outputs of the sensor or array of sensors. The detector can be housed in a sealed enclosure and energized by a battery.

title: Neural networks with learning and expression capability
abstract: A neural network comprising a plurality of neurons in which any one of the plurality of neurons is able to associate with itself or another neuron in the plurality of neurons via active connections to a further neuron in the plurality of neurons.

title: System and method for accelerating and optimizing the processing of machine learning techniques using a graphics processing unit
abstract: A system and method for processing machine learning techniques (such as neural networks) and other non-graphics applications using a graphics processing unit (GPU) to accelerate and optimize the processing. The system and method transfers an architecture that can be used for a wide variety of machine learning techniques from the CPU to the GPU. The transfer of processing to the GPU is accomplished using several novel techniques that overcome the limitations and work well within the framework of the GPU architecture. With these limitations overcome, machine learning techniques are particularly well suited for processing on the GPU because the GPU is typically much more powerful than the typical CPU. Moreover, similar to graphics processing, processing of machine learning techniques involves problems with solving non-trivial solutions and large amounts of data.

title: Flow data generation method, flow data generation apparatus, and flow data generation program product
abstract: A flow-data generation apparatus comprises a first unit extracting first binomial relation data to be a start point, a second unit associating second term of the first binomial relation data as a first child node with the start point as a first parent node, a third unit adding a relation type to an arc of the first binomial relation data, a fourth unit searching for third binomial relation data including first term of the third binomial relation data identical to second term of second binomial relation data, a fifth unit associating second term of the third binomial relation data as a second child node with the first term of the third binomial relation data as a second parent node, a sixth unit adding a relation type to an arc of the third binomial relation data, and an seventh unit repeating the searching, associating, and adding to generate a partial tree.

title: Molecular-junction-nanowire-crossbar-based neural network
abstract: A method for configuring nanoscale neural network circuits using molecular-junction-nanowire crossbars, and nanoscale neural networks produced by this method. Summing of weighted inputs within a neural-network node is implemented using variable-resistance resistors selectively configured at molecular-junction-nanowire-crossbar junctions. Thresholding functions for neural network nodes are implemented using pFET and nFET components selectively configured at molecular-junction-nanowire-crossbar junctions to provide an inverter. The output of one level of neural network nodes is directed, through selectively configured connections, to the resistor elements of a second level of neural network nodes via circuits created in the molecular-junction-nanowire crossbar. An arbitrary number of inputs, outputs, neural network node levels, nodes, weighting functions, and thresholding functions for any desired neural network are readily obtained by the methods of the present invention.

title: System and method for muting alarms during a conference
abstract: A system, method, apparatus, means, and computer program code for muting or disabling audible alarms or alerts during a conference or collaboration event are provided. During the conference or collaboration event, users may participate in the conference via user or client devices (e.g., computers) that are connected to or in communication with a server or collaboration system. A server, collaboration system or other device or application detects the setting of a mute alarm preference regarding one or more users. This may occur prior to a conference or during the conference. The server, collaboration system or other device then may cause the appropriate muting to occur at the appropriate or desired client devices and/or disable or mute audible alarms at one or more of the client devices (120a,120n,122a,122n).

title: Touch language
abstract: A touch language to be used by handicapped persons, such as deaf people, blind people, and deafblind people, is provided by the present invention. A method for communicating visual images, such as those of a television program, to a handicapped person comprises the steps of providing at least one device for physically transmitting information about the visual images to the handicapped person and delivering a key word describing a portion of the visual images to the handicapped person using the at least one device.

title: PROTEINS RELATED TO THE SRAG.
abstract: An isolated SRAG-related protein that has a sequence as set forth in SEQ ID NO. 1.

title: Method and apparatus for automatic organization for computer files
abstract: A method and apparatus to automatically organize computer files or web pages into meaning categories, to acquire new computer files or web pages, and to maintain the resulting organization in hierarchical directory tree structure. The method allows a user to provide a large number of unorganized files or an initial directory. The method partitions the unorganized files into hierarchically arranged categories that form an initial directory or allows a user to provide the initial directory. The method creates a description to summarize the contents of each of the categories in the directory. The method uses the descriptions in a classification step that assigns a newly given computer file to one of the categories. When the number of files in a category exceeds a user predefined limit, the method partitions some of the files into additional categories. The method updates the descriptions of a category and all its parent categories whenever additional files or categories are added into or removed from the category.

title: System and method for automated part-number mapping
abstract: Automated mapping of part numbers associated with parts in a bill of materials (BOM) submitted by a BOM originator to internal part numbers assigned to those parts by a BOM receiver is performed by one or more computers connected to one or more networks through one or more network interfaces.
